commit_message:
Expand get_file using to template scope

So we can use get_file in outputs section and parameters section
except resources section. For example, we can use get_file to set
default value for some parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1284493
Change-Id: If584ea108b437c28713925af68691c019e64e1fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/23/76223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_file_contents(template, files, template_base_url,

commit_message:
Ensure that the NoCloud data source is loaded

Add NoCloud to CentOS cloud.cfg data sources and remove /var/lib/cloud
before re-creating it to ensure that everything is re-run.

Closes-Bug: #1285891
Change-Id: I3594488aaa2329102e987874730ef325074f95ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/94/76994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -e /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/10_rackspace.cfg ]]; then sed -i 's/ConfigDrive, None/NoCloud/' /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/10_rackspace.cfg firm -rf /var/lib/cloud

commit_message:
Fix neutron-lbaas-agent issue

Currently, you cannot converge a CentOS (and presumably SUSE) node when
balancer recipe is in run list.  This is because no neutron_lb_packages
attributes have been specified.

Change-Id: I4d3428c69c7e6098b13aa15bf07e61defdc2a207
Closes-Bug: #1283237
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/09/75509/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default['openstack']['network']['lbaas']['device_driver'] = 'neutron.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.namespace_driver.HaproxyNSDriver' 'neutron_lb_packages' => ['openstack-neutron', 'haproxy'], 'neutron_lb_packages' => ['openstack-neutron-lbaas', 'haproxy'], 'neutron_lb_packages' => ['neutron-lbaas-agent', 'haproxy'],

commit_message:
Remove use of uuidutils.generate_uuid

Oslo is removing uuidutils.generate_uuid() during the icehouse cycle.
This patch moves generate_uuid to designate.utils.

Change-Id: I65c6d8e0d985c67f43682e9f3ae80997ee96d0f7
Partial-Bug: #1253497
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/68/76768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from designate import utils Column('id', UUID(), default=utils.generate_uuid, primary_key=True),
deleted_lines: from designate.openstack.common.uuidutils import generate_uuid Column('id', UUID(), default=generate_uuid, primary_key=True),

commit_message:
Adds a flag to determine whether to reload the rules in policy

Initing a Enforcer class with rules can not set rules,  because the policy
file is modified , the load_rules always try to load the rules from the cache
or config file when checks the policy. This patch adds a flag to determine
whether to reload the rules from policy file.

Closes-Bug: #1279198

Change-Id: Ife84189be4b86a3ee90da4539ff2dbed125be23d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/48/72848/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use mock.call_count to assert the call counter

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65424 , the unit test for
test_base_filter.py is not using mock.call_count to identify the
call counter.

This patch was using call_count to check that the filter was only
called once.

Change-Id: I792c894c0414d11ab7461b6e5cc9366ced787ebb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/60/76760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTrue(1, fake5_filter_all.call_count) result = self._get_filtered_objects(filter_classes, index=1) self.assertEqual(filter_objs_expected, result) self.assertTrue(1, fake5_filter_all.call_count)
deleted_lines: result = self._get_filtered_objects(filter_classes, index=1) self.assertEqual(filter_objs_expected, result) self.assertFalse(fake5_filter_all.called) self.assertTrue(fake5_filter_all.called)

commit_message:
Remove README from openstack/common

openstack/common should only include files from oslo-incubator now.
Assume every one understand that can't modify these files in openstack/common
directly. So remove the file README.

Change-Id: Ib9b677eb1ad5fb0bd26b018cd01f44d56683113c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/76848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: openstack-common ---------------- A number of modules from openstack-common are imported into this project. These modules are "incubating" in openstack-common and are kept in sync with the help of openstack-common's update.py script. See: http://wiki.openstack.org/CommonLibrary#Incubation The copy of the code should never be directly modified here. Please always update openstack-common first and then run the script to copy the changes across.

commit_message:
Use Python 2.6.x compatible syntax for dict comprehension

The dict comprehension syntax used here was added in 2.7.
With minimal change it can be adjusted for Python 2.6.x

Change-Id: I920c4a4181fdf5c696ba873224a2c07f09e914e4

commit_message:
Add verification that TestVM image exists

Added method that verifies if TestVM instance exists.
Added method invocation to all tests that use default
image. Moved get_image_from_name method to
OfficialClientTest class.

added_lines: def test_die(self): member_id_test2 = self._get_random_uuid() client2 = tooz.coordination.get_coordinator(self.backend, member_id_test2, **self.kwargs) client2.start() self._coord.create_group(self.group_id).get() self._coord.join_group(self.group_id).get() client2.join_group(self.group_id).get() members_ids = self._coord.get_members(self.group_id).get() self.assertTrue(self.member_id in members_ids) self.assertTrue(member_id_test2 in members_ids) client2.stop() members_ids = self._coord.get_members(self.group_id).get() self.assertTrue(self.member_id in members_ids) self.assertTrue(member_id_test2 not in members_ids)

Remove workaround for xmlrpbclib

Six >=1.5.2 included the fix , don't need workaround anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbb6a1cd6e5a9d28752ff0a06538d7435ddda83

commit_message:
Remove compute_rpcapi.remove_volume_connection

Before we move pre_live_migration into the conductor, make it easier to
call the rollback_live_migration from the conductor.

Part of blueprint live-migration-to-conductor
Change-Id: I59c7179fa580b7042a8e08a2094bf545e88b12d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/64875/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3.5 - Make rollback_live_migration_at_destination optionally take block_migration and migrate_data. It also deprecates the remove_volume_connection method. def rollback_live_migration_at_destination(self, ctxt, instance, block_migration, migrate_data, host): if self.can_send_version('3.5'): version = '3.5' elif self.can_send_version('3.0'): version = '3.0' else: # NOTE(russellb) Havana compat version = '2.0' instance=instance_p, block_migration, migrate_data)
deleted_lines: def remove_volume_connection(self, ctxt, instance, volume_id, host): # NOTE(russellb) Havana compat version = self._get_compat_version('3.0', '2.0') instance_p = jsonutils.to_primitive(instance) cctxt = self.client.prepare(server=host, version=version) return cctxt.call(ctxt, 'remove_volume_connection', instance=instance_p, volume_id=volume_id) def rollback_live_migration_at_destination(self, ctxt, instance, host): # NOTE(russellb) Havana compat version = self._get_compat_version('3.0', '2.0') instance=instance_p)

commit_message:
Add self.fail for telnet and apache murano tests

Deployed Murano for now do not support deployment
without pre-defined keypare for telnet and apache services
So this tests will be fail until Murano is updated.
So add self.fail in SetUp() for this tests that
do not wait and initialize objects for failed tests

Also fixed flake8 issues for test_platform_murano_linux.py

Change-Id: Ibf18339830b13618670d891c642c4bcfeb3376c4
Closes-bug: #1275710

commit_message:
Adding ChefSpec Custom Matchers for register LWRP

Replaced all lwrp testing in spec/registration_spec.rb with testing via
custom matchers. Also added test for :service_create call in
recipes/registration.rb.

Change-Id: I877b3f5b48fe5b85d9b7825ce5c20e16b157d531
Closes-Bug: #1253016
Addresses: blueprint chefspec-lwrp-for-identity
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/73/77073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # encoding: UTF-8 if defined?(ChefSpec) def create_service_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_service, resource_name) end def create_endpoint_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_endpoint, resource_name) end def create_tenant_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_tenant, resource_name) end def create_user_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_user, resource_name) end def create_role_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_role, resource_name) end def grant_role_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :grant_role, resource_name) end def create_ec2_credentials_openstack_identity_register(resource_name) ChefSpec::Matchers::ResourceMatcher.new( :openstack_identity_register, :create_ec2_credentials, resource_name) end end

commit_message:
Add timeout for waiting callback from deploy ramdisk

'callback_timeout' options added to conductor, if timeout reached
node switched to error state. New periodical task created for timeouts
check.

Related-Bug: #1270986
Change-Id: I3084d529baa13d4f848a7d050b8299582a28d7e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/72395/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_callback_timeout(self): self.node.provision_state = states.DEPLOYWAIT self.node.target_provision_state = states.DEPLOYDONE self.node.save(self.context) pxe._callback_timeout_handler(self.context, self.node.uuid) self.node.refresh(self.context) self.assertEqual(states.DEPLOYFAIL, self.node.provision_state) self.assertEqual(states.NOSTATE, self.node.target_provision_state) self.assertIn('Timeout', self.node.last_error) def test_callback_timeout_deploying(self): self.node.provision_state = states.DEPLOYING self.node.target_provision_state = states.DEPLOYDONE self.node.save(self.context) pxe._callback_timeout_handler(self.context, self.node.uuid) self.node.refresh(self.context) self.assertEqual(states.DEPLOYING, self.node.provision_state) self.assertEqual(states.DEPLOYDONE, self.node.target_provision_state) self.assertNotIn('Timeout', self.node.last_error) def test_callback_timeout_node_locked(self): self.node.provision_state = states.DEPLOYWAIT self.node.target_provision_state = states.DEPLOYDONE self.node.save(self.context) with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid): pxe._callback_timeout_handler(self.context, self.node.uuid) self.node.refresh(self.context) self.assertEqual(states.DEPLOYWAIT, self.node.provision_state) self.assertEqual(states.DEPLOYDONE, self.node.target_provision_state) self.assertNotIn('Timeout', self.node.last_error)

commit_message:
Add script to generate sample config for integration tests

Change-Id: I4af62159c9a98d383cafdeae830d0431effebcd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/45/76845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash print_hint() { echo "Try \`${0##*/} --help' for more information." >&2 } PARSED_OPTIONS=$(getopt -n "${0##*/}" -o hb:p:m:l:o: \ --long help,base-dir:,package-name:,output-dir:,module:,library: -- "$@") if [ $? != 0 ] ; then print_hint ; exit 1 ; fi eval set -- "$PARSED_OPTIONS" while true; do case "$1" in -h|--help) echo "${0##*/} [options]" echo "" echo "options:" echo "-h, --help show brief help" echo "-b, --base-dir=DIR project base directory" echo "-p, --package-name=NAME project package name" echo "-o, --output-dir=DIR file output directory" echo "-m, --module=MOD extra python module to interrogate for options" echo "-l, --library=LIB extra library that registers options for discovery" exit 0 ;; -b|--base-dir) shift BASEDIR=`echo $1 | sed -e 's/\/*$//g'` shift ;; -p|--package-name) shift PACKAGENAME=`echo $1` shift ;; -o|--output-dir) shift OUTPUTDIR=`echo $1 | sed -e 's/\/*$//g'` shift ;; -m|--module) shift MODULES="$MODULES -m $1" shift ;; -l|--library) shift LIBRARIES="$LIBRARIES -l $1" shift ;; --) break ;; esac done BASEDIR=${BASEDIR:-`pwd`} echo $BASEDIR if ! [ -d $BASEDIR ] then echo "${0##*/}: missing project base directory" >&2 ; print_hint ; exit 1 elif [[ $BASEDIR != /* ]] then BASEDIR=$(cd "$BASEDIR" && pwd) fi PACKAGENAME=${PACKAGENAME:-${BASEDIR##*/}} TARGETDIR=$BASEDIR/$PACKAGENAME if ! [ -d $TARGETDIR ] then echo "${0##*/}: invalid project package name" >&2 ; print_hint ; exit 1 fi TESTSDIR=$TARGETDIR/tests/integration OUTPUTDIR=${OUTPUTDIR:-$TESTSDIR/configs} # NOTE(bnemec): Some projects put their sample config in etc/, # some in etc/$PACKAGENAME/ if [ -d $OUTPUTDIR/$PACKAGENAME ] then OUTPUTDIR=$OUTPUTDIR/$PACKAGENAME elif ! [ -d $OUTPUTDIR ] then echo "${0##*/}: cannot access \`$OUTPUTDIR': No such file or directory" >&2 exit 1 fi BASEDIRESC=`echo $BASEDIR | sed -e 's/\//\\\\\//g'` find $TESTSDIR -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete FILES=$(find $TESTSDIR -type f -name "*.py" \ -exec grep -l "Opt(" {} + | sed -e "s/^$BASEDIRESC\///g" | sort -u) RC_FILE="`dirname $0`/oslo.config.generator.rc" if test -r "$RC_FILE" then source "$RC_FILE" fi for mod in ${SAVANNA_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES}; do MODULES="$MODULES -m $mod" done for lib in ${SAVANNA_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES}; do LIBRARIES="$LIBRARIES -l $lib" done export EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS=yes #OS_VARS=$(set | sed -n '/^OS_/s/=[^=]*$//gp' | xargs) #[ "$OS_VARS" ] && eval "unset \$OS_VARS" DEFAULT_MODULEPATH=savanna.openstack.common.config.generator MODULEPATH=${MODULEPATH:-$DEFAULT_MODULEPATH} OUTPUTFILE=$OUTPUTDIR/itest.conf.sample-full python -m $MODULEPATH $MODULES $LIBRARIES $FILES > $OUTPUTFILE # Hook to allow projects to append custom config file snippets CONCAT_FILES=$(ls $BASEDIR/tools/config/*.conf.sample 2>/dev/null) for CONCAT_FILE in $CONCAT_FILES; do cat $CONCAT_FILE >> $OUTPUTFILE done

commit_message:
Update sample integration tests config

Change-Id: Id287fca167c5eba9b6ee01bc8aacf06cf1058652
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/52/76852/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [DEFAULT] # # Options defined in savanna.tests.integration.configs.config # # Username for OpenStack. (string value) #OS_USERNAME=admin # Password for OpenStack. (string value) #OS_PASSWORD=admin # Tenant name for OpenStack. (string value) #OS_TENANT_NAME=admin # Tenant ID for OpenStack. (string value) #OS_TENANT_ID=<None> # URL for OpenStack. (string value) #OS_AUTH_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 # OpenStack auth version for Swift. (string value) #SWIFT_AUTH_VERSION=2 # Host for Savanna. (string value) #SAVANNA_HOST=127.0.0.1 # Port for Savanna. (integer value) #SAVANNA_PORT=8386 # API version for Savanna. (string value) #SAVANNA_API_VERSION=1.1 # OpenStack flavor ID for virtual machines. If you leave the # default value of this parameter, then flavor ID will be # created automatically, using nova client. The created flavor # will have the following parameters: name=i-test-flavor-<id>, # ram=1024, vcpus=1, disk=10, ephemeral=10. <id> is ID of 8 # characters (letters and/or digits) which is added to name of # flavor for its uniqueness. (string value) #FLAVOR_ID=<None> # Cluster creation timeout (in minutes); minimal value is 1.#CLUSTER_CREATION_TIMEOUT=30 # Timeout for node process deployment on cluster nodes (in # minutes); minimal value is 1. (integer value) #TELNET_TIMEOUT=5 # Timeout for HDFS initialization (in minutes); minimal value # is 1. subject: Debian: fix package and service names
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 13:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_agents_vpnaas_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_metering_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/a80d0baef5173e95f10b212b1c4311c31667c3c8', 'message': 'Debian: fix package and service names

In previous commits, Neutron Metering and VPNaaS agents services and
packages names have been modified to support Ubuntu, in breaking Debian
support.
This patch aims to fix it.

Change-Id: Iff9f8a925bca8534fe6672c3ab84513aa0416cd5
Partial-Bug: #1284179
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Debian: fix package and service names

In previous commits, Neutron Metering and VPNaaS agents services and
packages names have been modified to support Ubuntu, in breaking Debian
support.
This patch aims to fix it.

Change-Id: Iff9f8a925bca8534fe6672c3ab84513aa0416cd5
Partial-Bug: #1284179
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/58/76858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'on Ubuntu platforms' do { :osfamily => 'Debian', :operatingsystem => 'Ubuntu' } context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian', :operatingsystem => 'Debian' } end let :platform_params do { :metering_agent_package => 'neutron-metering-agent', :metering_agent_service => 'neutron-metering-agent' } end it_configures 'neutron metering agent' end

When profiling the caching scheduler, the time taken was almost halved
by adding this small amount of caching configuration in the
filters and weights.

Using the default configuration, with 200 hosts, performed by running
test_caching_scheduler as a script, showed these optimizations to take
the per schedule time down from near 20ms to under 4ms.

This means the time taken to process 1000 schedule requests, with the
caching scheduler, has been reduced to under 4 seconds, from 20 seconds.

Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I555804fcc6a724364242a349f079704f07497250

commit_message:
Optimize filters and weights

This change caches configuration, and reduces logging, to speed up the
operation of the scheduler.

Using the default configuration, with 200 hosts, performed by running
test_caching_scheduler as a script, showed these optimizations to take
the per schedule time down from near 20ms to under 4ms.

This means the time taken to process 1000 schedule requests, with the
caching scheduler, has been reduced to under 4 seconds, from 20 seconds.

Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I555804fcc6a724364242a349f079704f07497250

commit_message:
Fix IPAddress and CIDR type decorators

Use load_dialect_impl() user hook instead of calling
with_variant() on a type implementation in IPAddress
and CIDR type decorators. This makes this code work
with SQLAlchemy 0.8.x versions.

Fixes bug 1200231

Change-Id: Ib0eb582f472116bda817d3e35e26888dc116ad58
(cherry picked from commit cd382933eb5b6b09f34398cf2c963164bc5b6fc7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/53167/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: impl = types.String def load_dialect_impl(self, dialect): if dialect.name == 'postgresql': return dialect.type_descriptor(postgresql.INET()) else: return dialect.type_descriptor(types.String(39)) impl = types.String def load_dialect_impl(self, dialect): if dialect.name == 'postgresql': return dialect.type_descriptor(postgresql.INET()) else: return dialect.type_descriptor(types.String(43))

subject: Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 18:24:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/install-dependencies'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/3690dcb9933c13dac6cc680dcb13f0db107d63ad', 'message': "Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group

The current mechanism for picking up the new group doesn't work
correctly anyway (see bug report for a full example of the current
behavior), and it's more friendly to stop immediately and let the
user know what they need to do instead of continuing on and

Closes-Bug: 1285285

commit_message:
Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group

The current mechanism for picking up the new group doesn't work
correctly anyway (see bug report for a full example of the current
behavior), and it's more friendly to stop immediately and let the
user know what they need to do instead of continuing on and
failing, which buries the relevant message further up the
scrollback.

Change-Id: I94bdb331567b92b572953d839605ed4c2108e8ec
Closes-Bug: 1285285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/26/76926/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "$USER was just added the the $LIBVIRTD_GROUP. Devtest will not" echo "be able to continue until you start a new session to pick up the" echo "new group membership. This can be done by either logging out and" echo "back in, or running:" echo echo "sudo su -l $USER" echo echo "To verify that your group membership is correct, you can use the" echo "following command:" echo echo "id | grep $LIBVIRTD_GROUP" echo echo "Once you have verified your group membership, you should be able to" echo "re-run devtest and continue successfully." # We have to exit non-zero so the calling script knows to stop. exit 1
deleted_lines: exec sudo su -l $USER -c "PATH=$PATH $0" echo "Check to see that you are in the $LIBVIRTD_GROUP group in your current shell before going on. You can check by running:" echo echo "id | grep $LIBVIRTD_GROUP" echo echo "If you are not, it's because this script added you. You can pick up the group by logging out and back in, or run:" echo echo "sudo su -l $USER"

commit_message:
Use uuid instead of uuidutils

The generate_uuid() functions will be deprecated/removed from uuidutils/
This patch replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid() with str(uuid.uuid4()).

Change-Id: I40e2dbf5e9e04b0109b1185df70e4f4ba93a17c9
Partial-Bug: #1253497

commit_message:
Remove apps from settings

Those lines are supposed to be replaced by their
counterparts in openstack_dashboard/enabled
and not used any more here. It's a leftover
and was forgotten to remove in
blueprint plugin-architecture

Implements blueprint plugin-architecture

Change-Id: I88ed5886304673391074f1cb681554a9288985e8

commit_message:
LBaaS: check for associations before deleting health monitor

Need to prohibit health monitor deletion if it has associations with
pools. Given that pools may belong to different lbaas drivers the process
of monitor deletion becomes complex and unreliable since association
deletion may fail on any single driver.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1243129
Change-Id: I27c20e7a5be8433f90569534ecf838e33027cb00

added_lines: def test_delete_healthmonitor_has_associations(self): with self.health_monitor(type='HTTP') as monitor: # try to delete the HealthMonitor instance self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 409) qry = ctx.session.query(ldb.HealthMonitor) qry = qry.filter_by(id=monitor['health_monitor']['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(qry.first()) # check if all corresponding Pool associations are not deleted self.assertTrue(qry.all()) # disassociate the health_monitor from the pool first req = self.new_delete_request( "pools", fmt=self.fmt, id=pool['pool']['id'], subresource="health_monitors", sub_id=health_monitor['health_monitor']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 204) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), health_mon1['health_monitor']['id'], pool['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), health_mon2['health_monitor']['id'], pool['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), hm['health_monitor']['id'], pool['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), hm['health_monitor']['id'], p1['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), hm['health_monitor']['id'], p2['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), hm['health_monitor']['id'], pool['pool']['id']) self.plugin.delete_pool_health_monitor( context.get_admin_context(), hm['health_monitor']['id'], pool['pool']['id'])
deleted_lines: def test_delete_healthmonitor_cascade_deletion_of_associations(self): with self.health_monitor(type='HTTP', no_delete=True) as monitor: # delete the HealthMonitor instance self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 204) # check if all corresponding Pool associations are deleted self.assertFalse(qry.all())

commit_message:
Check server terminations on "delete server" tests

Current "delete server" tests check the API response code only
and do not check server terminations. In current tests, Tempest
cannot detect the termination errors even if they happen.
This patch adds the checks for these tests.

Change-Id: Ib9ba09e86819d7f1027c90cf3ca98dee350125e8

commit_message:
Nova V2 APIs for Domain Quota Management

V2 APIs in Nova for using Domain Quota Driver to manage the quotas at domain, project and user level.
These APIs will enable Nova to enforce domain quotas. These APIs are implemented using new extension
domain-quota-sets

Change-Id: I6aecf0723ce68cf507358ec872dedd2e07f47e4f
Implements: blueprint domain-quota-driver-api

commit_message:
Added NFS max use and oversub ratios

Added the ability to configure additional cinder options for allocating
the over-subscription ratio and for setting the max disk use ratio.

Change-Id: I5387563d5cc869e8be38c8d5a4d9c0d0fc3be469

commit_message:
Add support for custom libvirt uri

SSH driver executes "virsh list --all" without setting the default
libvirt uri. It can cause issues eg. on Fedora where the default uri is
"qemu:///session" instead of "qemu:///system" and as a result it doesn't
find any domain. This patch adds support for setting libvirt uri.

Change-Id: If714913c8b41097f25026afabbb88aa90c496d81
Closes-bug: #1281025
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/62/74062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: libvirt_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('libvirt_uri', default='', help='libvirt uri') ] CONF.register_opts(libvirt_opts)if CONF.libvirt_uri: COMMAND_SETS['virsh']['base_cmd'] = "LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI=%s %s" % ( CONF.libvirt_uri, '/usr/bin/virsh')

commit_message:
Use remove_warnings from puppet-keystone

Glance client is getting the same warnings as Keystone client,
hence puppet-glance should use the same hack as puppet-keystone
until providers will be refactored to use API calls instead.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1043725 for more details

Change-Id: I99e4308d0731307c019ad6cab8db5feee1b0ed73
(cherry picked from commit 9bc8d08681d6fdf1bbe682625ea9500118f21e3b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/49/74749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remove_warnings(glance('-T', g['admin_tenant_name'], '-I', g['admin_user'], '-K', g['admin_password'], '-N', auth_endpoint, args)) remove_warnings(glance('-T', g['admin_tenant_name'], '-I', g['admin_user'], '-K', g['admin_password'], '-N', auth_endpoint, args)) # Remove warning from the output. This is a temporary hack until # things will be refactored to use the REST API def self.remove_warnings(results) found_header = false in_warning = false results.split("\n").collect do |line| unless found_header if line =~ /^\+[-\+]+\+$/ in_warning = false found_header = true line elsif line =~ /^WARNING/ or line =~ /UserWarning/ or in_warning # warnings can be multi line, we have to skip all of them in_warning = true nil else line end else line end end.compact.join("\n") end
deleted_lines: glance('-T', g['admin_tenant_name'], '-I', g['admin_user'], '-K', g['admin_password'], '-N', auth_endpoint, args) glance('-T', g['admin_tenant_name'], '-I', g['admin_user'], '-K', g['admin_password'], '-N', auth_endpoint, args)

commit_message:
Check that 'heat_template_version' is a HOT version

Previously, any value could be specified as the 'heat_template_version'.
Check that 'heat_template_version' is a valid HOT version and raise a
ValueError if it is not.

Change-Id: I7f9a7acd52cf6273a4730091c08b8cd1a5e07961
Closes-Bug: #1277215
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/21/73021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # defer import of HOT module to avoid circular dependency version = template['heat_template_version'] valid_versions = hot.HOTemplate.VERSIONS if version in valid_versions: return hot.HOTemplate(template, *args, **kwargs) else: msg = _("%(version)s is not a valid " "heat_template_version. Should be one of: " "%(valid)s") raise ValueError(msg % {'version': version, 'valid': str(valid_versions)})
deleted_lines: # deferred import of HOT module to avoid circular dependency return hot.HOTemplate(template, *args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Python 3: replace "im_self" by "__self__"

The Python 3 removed the "im_self" attribute and only supports the
"__self__". This patch replaces "im_self" by "__self__" attribute.

Closes-Bug: #1282514
Change-Id: Ib017fff4b720a5dd7ee27fd01b36a531d9b6ca9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/74946/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(method, '__self__') and method.__self__ is not None: try: meth_pieces.insert(0, method.__self__.__class__.__name__)
deleted_lines: if hasattr(method, 'im_self') and method.im_self is not None: try: meth_pieces.insert(0, method.im_self.__class__.__name__)

commit_message:
"version" section should be required in template

Adding the version checking to keep place with heat.

Change-Id: Ib2f0b55c3c9e8b0a8f26e972b37a979d8d703f7c
Closes-Bug: #1273980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/08/69808/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Looking for supported version keys in the loaded template if not ('HeatTemplateFormatVersion' in tpl or 'heat_template_version' in tpl or 'AWSTemplateFormatVersion' in tpl): raise ValueError("Template format version not found.")
deleted_lines: if u'heat_template_version' not in tpl: default_for_missing(tpl, u'HeatTemplateFormatVersion', HEAT_VERSIONS) def default_for_missing(tpl, version_param, versions): '''Checks a parsed template for missing version and sections. This is currently only applied to YAML templates. ''' # if version is missing, implicitly use the lastest one if version_param not in tpl: tpl[version_param] = versions[-1] # create empty placeholders for any of the main dict sections for param in (u'Parameters', u'Mappings', u'Resources', u'Outputs'): if param not in tpl: tpl[param] = {}

commit_message:
Clean-up config files for API and Manager

Moves some config files for better clarity, and adds the possibility to
define climate-api.conf and climate-manager.conf

Change-Id: I8b628d051a563bec9f644710e44b6d87a1f7de88
Closes-Bug: #1284716

commit_message:
Fix neutronclient element for package based install

On package based install, there is no virtualenv for
neutronclient. We can only warn the admin for now.

Change-Id: I02507a0fac4bdab1d3c20f60b2f1f6fb9a1321fc

commit_message:
Add LOGS_DIR option and fix getopt string for 'e'.

Change-Id: I179604848750a45c564121e0cb9722a07a9ed9a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/70/76870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -l (dir) - Path to logs directory. Can be set by LOGS_DIR evironment variable. Uses WORKSPACE/logs if not set. while getopts ":w:j:i:t:o:a:A:m:U:r:b:V:l:dkKe:h" opt; do l) LOGS_DIR="${OPTARG}" ;; if [ "${LOGS_DIR}" = "" ]; then LOGS_DIR="${WORKSPACE}/logs" fi export LOGS_DIR
deleted_lines: while getopts ":w:j:i:t:o:a:A:m:U:r:b:V:dkKeh" opt; do export LOGS_DIR="${WORKSPACE}/logs"

milestone creation.

Also fixes wrong comment on the sample yaml file.

Change-Id: Ie8e7b5942a02706c7c2b03c2d680c23ae85edef6

commit_message:
Add support for RC milestone creation

RC milestones need to use a specific code name ("RC1"). This change
makes sure create_milestones.py sets the right code name for RC
milestone creation.

Also fixes wrong comment on the sample yaml file.

Change-Id: Ie8e7b5942a02706c7c2b03c2d680c23ae85edef6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/77/76877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if m.startswith("rc"): code_name = m.upper() else: code_name=series.name[0:1] + m code_name=code_name)

commit_message:
Refactoring metadata/base

- Extracted out methods from get_openstack_item for handling version, content and path
- Replaced the if else style route configuration with a route configuration dict
- This will help adding new apis easier and be maintainable

Change-Id: Ie1885c439f3d119032dd1c7c7af070142987ba7f
Partially implements: blueprint metadata-service-callbacks

test_update_metadata(self): inst_md = fake_InstanceMetadata(self.stubs, self.instance, extra_md={"foo": "bar"}) metadata_update_method = inst_md.lookup("/openstack/latest/meta_data") self.assertEqual('_handle_update_metadata', metadata_update_method.func_name) def test_raises_exception_for_os_version_before_icehouse(self): inst_md = fake_InstanceMetadata(self.stubs, self.instance, extra_md={"foo": "bar"}) self.assertRaises(base.InvalidMetadataPath, inst_md.lookup, "/openstack/2013-10-17/metadata") class MetadataUpdateTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(MetadataUpdateTestCase, self).setUp() fake_network.stub_out_nw_api_get_instance_nw_info(self.stubs) self.api = compute_api.API self.context = context.RequestContext('fake_user_id', 'fake_project_id') self.instance = fake_inst_obj(self.context) self.flags(use_local=True, group='conductor') self.inst_metadata = fake_InstanceMetadata(self.stubs, self.instance, address=None, sgroups=None) def test_post_is_the_only_supported_method(self): request = webob.Request.blank('') request.method = 'PUT' self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPMethodNotAllowed, update.handle_update, request, self.inst_metadata) def test_should_raise_exception_if_meta_key_is_absent(self): request = webob.Request.blank('') request.method = 'POST' request.body = jsonutils.dumps({"key": "value"}) self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, update.handle_update, request, self.inst_metadata) def test_metadata_update(self): request = webob.Request.blank('') request.method = 'POST' request.body = jsonutils.dumps({"meta": {"key": "value"}}) req_metadata = {"from_server_key": "value"} res_metadata = {"foo": "bar", "meta": {"from_server_key": "value"}} self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.api, "update_instance_metadata") self.mox.StubOutWithMock(context, 'get_admin_context') ctx = self.mox.CreateMock(context.RequestContext) context.get_admin_context().AndReturn(ctx) self.api.update_instance_metadata(ctx, self.instance, req_metadata).AndReturn(res_metadata) self.mox.ReplayAll() update.handle_update(request, self.inst_metadata) def test_should_raise_exception_if_req_contains_keys_other_than_meta( self): request = webob.Request.blank('') request.method = 'POST' request.body = jsonutils.dumps({"meta": {"key": "value"}, "invalid_key": "invalid_value"}) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(context, 'get_admin_context') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.api, "update_instance_metadata") self.mox.ReplayAll() self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, update.handle_update, request, self.inst_metadata) self.mox.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Cleanup _interface class variables in compute/v3

We've already removed xml interface from Nova V3 APIs. So we can assume
the default is json. This commit sets _interface = 'json' to
BaseV3ComputeTest class and removes redundancy.

Change-Id: Ie9ad2242d20ce90fca74ca7a5390e0971f830caa

commit_message:
Prevent GET /v1/nodes returning maintenance field

GET /v1/nodes shouldn't return internal fields such as
'maintenance'.  Remove this field from the dictionary
returned, and test to make sure it doesn't come back.

Change-Id: I62b2be62ca2ca30c3fd63a1d9fe643b01fc4f171
Closes-Bug: #1282517

commit_message:
Move ipminative _set_boot_device to VendorPassthru

_set_boot_device must be exposed via vendor_passthru, allowing
operators to manually change it, and force to boot from net when
performing a pxe deploy.
Until now, it was just a private method of the power driver.

Change-Id: Iac3a7183db4c3486bd6a2aa1ba36bf33e11722a9
Partial-Bug: #1264596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/72495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class VendorPassthru(base.VendorInterface): def validate(self, node, **kwargs): method = kwargs['method'] if method == 'set_boot_device': device = kwargs.get('device', None) if device not in ipmi_command.boot_devices: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(_( "Invalid boot device %s specified.") % device) else: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(_( "Unsupported method (%s) passed to IPMINative driver.") % method) return True def vendor_passthru(self, task, node, **kwargs): method = kwargs['method'] if method == 'set_boot_device': return self._set_boot_device( task, node, kwargs.get('device'), kwargs.get('persistent', False))

Do not allow POST ports and chassis internal attributes

possibility of set/modify. This patch uses 'readonly' parameter of
WSME 0.6 for prohibit these attributes in POST.

possibility of set/modify. This patch uses 'readonly' parameter
of WSME 0.6 for prohibit these attributes in POST.

commit_message:
Removing get_node_power_state, bumping RPC version

There is a periodic task that is used to check the power state and save it to
the DB. Users can query the DB instead of checking the machine. Also removing
the RPC call and bumping RPC_API_VERSION to 1.10.

Closes-Bug: #1277062
Change-Id: I87923eee8f88e85e621fd0bf839d99250788561f

commit_message:
Fix cache lock for image not consistent

Currently 2 external (file) locks with different name
are created to protect image concurrent access for libvirt driver.
This may lead to image corruption in rare case. This patch change
the lock file name from nova-_var_lib_nova_instances_base_xxxx
to nova-xxxx to make the lock name consistent

Change-Id: I3e60c3bcf456d2392409aa56ba05f4ad8fdc0444
Closes-Bug: #1265452

commit_message:
Restrict rootwrap find filter for NetAppNFS driver

Additional make the name of the filter unique, so it does not override
any other rule. Like the find rule of the GPFS driver.
Rootwrap is making use of plain python ConfigParser which handles INI files
with key=value pair like fashion. Where the key is unique.

Closes-Bug: 1250101

Change-Id: Id2f193485089e12f00008b38fad2b95a09674ff2

commit_message:
Ensures NetApp iSCSI driver correctly compares int values for size

The NetApp iSCSI driver needs to verify that the new size requested
during an extend operation does not exceed the max_resize of the
lun.  However, the driver was doing a >= compare against str values
of the sizes rather than the int values.  This caused the incorrect
code path to be used in certain situations.

Change-Id: I8bc66c71db6b469c7adf00ce8b5091513fccb740
Closes-Bug: 1281279
(cherry picked from commit a1d78df1b7c95dbb5024023662932cd94313dd58)

commit_message:
Restrict the length of the Security Group name input

There is an allowed maximum length for security group name field, but in
current code, it doesn't check or restrict that from UI side, i.e. user
will be able to type in more than what is allowed. After form
submission, it will fail but there is no clear message telling user what
caused failure.

After adding the code to restrict the max length of the security group
name field, user will not be able to input more than what is allowed,
thus this error will be prevented from UI.

Change-Id: I0f560e78e67a0259343f1a2c820270506653b254

commit_message:
Fix volume stats with multiple LeftHand clusters

When more than one cluster exists in a LeftHand management
group, get_volume_stats may return the stats for the wrong
cluster. This patch fixes the problem by listing the cluster
name in the getClusterInfo query.

Change-Id: I2d5a76869c6bb1b3d514f0546ea00998e5ee32fb
Closes-Bug: #1279897

commit_message:
make service_check fatal

if we fail service check, we should do so in a fatal way, because
something is not right. This will be very useful in grenade.

Change-Id: I18811b0d8e6d06f364685c366cdc8f5dda3b8f7e

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enabled check

* Remove the check for neutron enabled on a block of variable settings, there
  is no conflict and serves no purpose.
* Also floating_ips.sh and volume.sh needed to properly source lib/neutron
  for do ping_check() to work properly.

The current error in check-devstack-dsvm-neutron is not related to this fix.

Change-Id: I1c458aaa787ffb98c945aefc3afa80c6861a405f

commit_message:
Use nova network-create --bridge for FlatDHCP

Although it's not documented anywhere, the --bridge-interface option is
only used by the VLAN network manager, but this page explicitly
uses FlatDHCP, so the --bridge option is appropriate.

Change-Id: I2bb13ba53cdc09171f16862f6915687a07de2150
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/71/76971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make PBR based setup completely optional

Moves back to a more python based setup.py
setup.cfg is still used, so if you need to use a pbr setup.py you still
can

Change-Id: If92fa4954452bec215a265cb0b92b2ec44ae1d93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/38/73738/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # Copyright (c) 2010-2014 OpenStack# This is a standard python setup.py, if you absolutely require a pbr # based setup, setup.cfg still exists, so you can use a standard pbr setup.py from ConfigParser import RawConfigParser from setuptools import setup, find_packages from swift import __canonical_version__ as version def get_options(section, option): # This will get a list of options from the setup.cfg # We need to do this until something like distutils2 gets out of alpha return [option for option in config.get(section, option).split('\n') if option != ''] # Read in the requirements with open('requirements.txt', 'r') as f: requires = [x.strip() for x in f if x.strip()] # Read and parse setup.cfg config = RawConfigParser() config.read('setup.cfg') setup( name=config.get('metadata', 'name'), version=version, description=config.get('metadata', 'summary'), license='Apache License (2.0)', author=config.get('metadata', 'author'), author_email=config.get('metadata', 'author-email'), url=config.get('metadata', 'home-page'), packages=find_packages(exclude=['test', 'bin']), test_suite='nose.collector', classifiers=get_options('metadata', 'classifier'), install_requires=requires, scripts=get_options('files', 'scripts'), entry_points={ 'paste.app_factory': get_options('entry_points', 'paste.app_factory'), 'paste.filter_factory': get_options('entry_points', 'paste.filter_factory'), }, )
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright (c) 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.# THIS FILE IS MANAGED BY THE GLOBAL REQUIREMENTS REPO - DO NOT EDIT import setuptools setuptools.setup( setup_requires=['pbr>=0.5.21,<1.0'], pbr=True)

added_lines: <para>All the files in this section can be found in the <systemitem>/etc/keystone</systemitem> directory.</para> <section xml:id="section_keystone.conf"> <title>keystone.conf</title> <para>The majority of the Identity service configuration is performed from the <filename>keystone.conf</filename> file.</para> <para> <programlisting language="ini"><xi:include parse="text" href="http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/plain/etc/keystone.conf.sample"/> </programlisting> </para> </section> <section xml:id="section_keystone-paste.ini"> <title>keystone-paste.ini</title> <para>The keystone-paste.ini file configures the Identity Service WSGI middleware pipeline.</para> <para> <programlisting language="ini"><xi:include parse="text" href="http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/plain/etc/keystone-paste.ini"/> </programlisting> </para> </section> <section xml:id="section_keystone-logging.conf"> <title>logging.conf</title> <para>A special logging configuration file can be specified in the <filename>keystone.conf</filename> configuration file (for example, <filename>/etc/logging.conf</filename>). For details, see the Python logging module documentation ( <link xlink:href="http://docs.python.org/2/howto/logging.html#configuring-logging">Python Logging</link>).</para> <para> <programlisting language="ini"><xi:include parse="text" href="http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/plain/etc/logging.conf.sample"/> </programlisting> </para> </section> <section xml:id="section_keystone-policy.json"> <title>policy.json</title> <para>The <filename>policy.json</filename> file defines additional access controls that apply to the Identity service.</para> <para> <programlisting language="ini"><xi:include parse="text" href="http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/plain/etc/policy.json"/> </programlisting> </para> </section> </section>

commit_message:
cfn-signal provides a unique default id

Unless the parameter is provided, cfn-signal will use the instance UUID
from the Nova metadata as the id sent back to the WaitCondition.
In case the Nova metadata isn't available, it will use the hostname as a
fallback.

Change-Id: I1e5847c7babd7c6295d8c3e21f6cfa110a9b3026
Closes-bug: 1223429

commit_message:
Switch [sql] to [database]

All services have now moved to the syntax:

[database]

connection = mysql://....

This patch updates them to ensure the right configuration method
is used.

Change-Id: I838c96710114336f8d58fbe42a8f508c8b01fb18

commit_message:
Skip EC2VolumesTest if Cinder is not available

While other volume tests are skipped if Cinder is not available,
such skips are not present in the EC2 tests.

Change-Id: I9f28cf5ea094c0ae2cd6522e15318aada354a369
Closes-Bug: 1282833
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/67/75267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import configCONF = config.CONF if not CONF.service_available.cinder: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as Cinder is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg)

commit_message:
Add more information to BuildErrorException

This commit adds expected_status to BuildErrorException. This is helpful
for checking the error details.

Change-Id: I2979d39467daeb06793081b83e3a5b81b7d5623e
Closes-bug: #1265559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/71719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message = ("%s failed to get to expected status (%s). " "In %s state.") % (thing, expected_status, new_status)
deleted_lines: message = ("%s failed to get to expected status. " "In %s state.") % (thing, new_status)

commit_message:
Enforce function declaration format in bash8

Check that function calls look like ^function foo {$ in bash8, and fix
all existing failures of that check.  Add a note to HACKING.rst

Change-Id: Ic19eecb39e0b20273d1bcd551a42fe400d54e938

added_lines: - functions should be declared as per the regex ^function foo() {$ with code starting on the next line

subject: Fix table name typo in test_sql_upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 01:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/82e32076b625dea606fc065d65bc4764e205e3c2', 'message': "Fix table name typo in test_sql_upgrade

There was an assertion that group_domain__metadata didn't exist.
The table is called group_domain_metadata so this wasn't asserting
anything useful.

Change-Id: I27e64a2d29ad51b24d42f2dfc9c2143506917410
"}]
commit_message:
Fix table name typo in test_sql_upgrade

There was an assertion that group_domain__metadata didn't exist.
The table is called group_domain_metadata so this wasn't asserting
anything useful.

Change-Id: I27e64a2d29ad51b24d42f2dfc9c2143506917410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/29/76729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTableDoesNotExist('group_domain_metadata')

commit_message:
Component DB schema and object model

    - Added Component DB schema and object model.
    - Added two exceptions specific to components.
    - Added tests for the component schema change.

Change-Id: I25c22f8fefcb062a63104f538249e0e9647b6553
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/60/71360/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 - Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from solum.objects import registry from solum.objects.sqlalchemy import component from solum.tests import base from solum.tests import utils class TestComponent(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestComponent, self).setUp() self.db = self.useFixture(utils.Database()) self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() self.data = [{'project_id': 'project_id_blah', 'user_id': 'fred', 'name': 'component1', 'type': 'component', 'description': 'test component', 'tags': 'component tags'}] for ad in self.data: ta = component.Component() for key, value in ad.items(): setattr(ta, key, value) ta.create(self.ctx) ad['id'] = ta.id def test_objects_registered(self): self.assertTrue(registry.Component) self.assertTrue(registry.ComponentList) def test_get_all(self): lst = component.ComponentList() self.assertEqual(1, len(lst.get_all(self.ctx))) def test_check_data(self): ta = component.Component().get_by_id(self.ctx, self.data[0]['id']) for key, value in self.data[0].items(): self.assertEqual(value, getattr(ta, key))

subject: Multiple service providers with same driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-26 12:27:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/22001aa3f358054f77be50050f977278481bf431', 'message': 'Passing configuration name to a driver

For the ability to load same driver as a service provider
with different configurations, a service provider name is passed
to a driver when instantiated.
So driver configuration name in configuration file is not hardcoded
in code anymore.

Change-Id: I01f28cb7e98edc2e1e288be69782726c17c2d196
Closes-Bug: #1264111
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-26 14:54:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5d7850264e5d7817ab42c6e3d7c5d0d6d44d8f80', 'message': 'Passing configuration name to a driver

For the ability to load same driver as a service provider
with different configurations, a service provider name is passed
to a driver when instantiated.
So driver configuration name in configuration file is not hardcoded
in code anymore.

Since driver can be used now with different provider name,
changed the logger name of radware driver to have the provider name.

Change-Id: I01f28cb7e98edc2e1e288be69782726c17c2d196
Closes-Bug: #1264111
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-29 12:09:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/03ae44c7c7d274af5258b559a04ed7c70e5c391f', 'message': "Multiple service providers with same driver

For the ability to load same driver with different configurations
as different service providers, a service provider name is passed
to a driver when instantiated. Now, a driver can load it's configuration
accordingly to the provider name raceived.
Driver path must not be unique anymore. Service type and provider name
still should be a unique combination.
Driver configuration name in configuration file is not hardcoded
in code anymore.

Provider configuration tests modified accordingly to new behavior.

Since driver can be used now with different provider name,
changed the logger name of radware driver to have the provider name.

Change-Id: I01f28cb7e98edc2e1e288be69782726c17c2d196
Closes-Bug: #1264111
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-29 13:45:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8185b3df0ddef56d404a57558983f04e1670f483', 'message': "Multiple service providers with same driver

commit_message:
Multiple service providers with same driver

For the ability to load same driver with different configurations
as different service providers, a service provider name is passed
to a driver when instantiated. Now, a driver can load it's configuration
according to the provider name received.
Driver path must not be unique anymore. Service type and provider name
still should be a unique combination.
Driver configuration name in configuration file is not hardcoded
in code anymore.

Provider configuration and service type tests modified
according to new behavior.

Since driver can be used now with different provider name,
changed the logger name of radware driver to have the provider name.

Added specific unit test for testing the new capability

Change-Id: I01f28cb7e98edc2e1e288be69782726c17c2d196
Closes-Bug: #1264111

commit_message:
Add V2 nova client for PCI device info

All PCI pass through code is merged into nova, but the client does not
support it. This patch extends the API to show PCI information for
instance and compute node, and also provides a resource: endpoint to
show PCI infomation.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: I5c1139a9ae8b9c51158b4f901c39a3c79b0b30c3

commit_message:
Enable create user without password

Keystone V2 ReST API allows create user without password, however,
CLI doesn't, this is because CLI will fill password with value None
while keystone server side doesn't accept such value.

This patch delete password field if it is not set.

Change-Id: I8542f99263ecd490212f91c1757b0aa7ee0bb624
Closes-Bug: #1273988

commit_message:
Add the gettextutils module to the openstack-common.conf

This change is adding the gettextutils module to the openstack-
common.conf file

Change-Id: Ib8f64d3a7f2adf69a2a4a2042c2ee71c96f300f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/76/63776/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from novaclient.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa if six.PY3: return _t.gettext(msg) from six import moves moves.builtins.__dict__['_'] = _lazy_gettext if six.PY3: gettext.install(domain, localedir=os.environ.get(localedir)) else: gettext.install(domain, localedir=os.environ.get(localedir), unicode=True) self._locale = None if six.PY3: ugettext = lang.gettext else: ugettext = lang.ugettext ugettext(self._msg) + @property def locale(self): return self._locale @locale.setter def locale(self, value): self._locale = value if not self.params: return # This Message object may have been constructed with one or more # Message objects as substitution parameters, given as a single # Message, or a tuple or Map containing some, so when setting the # locale for this Message we need to set it for those Messages too. if isinstance(self.params, Message): self.params.locale = value return if isinstance(self.params, tuple): for param in self.params: if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value return if isinstance(self.params, dict): for param in self.params.values(): if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value params[key] = six.text_type(dict_param[key]) self.params = six.text_type(other) if six.PY3: return self.__unicode__() 'domain', 'params', '_locale'] # this check when the master list updates to >=1.0, and update all projects """Gets a localized version of the given message in the given locale. If the message is not a Message object the message is returned as-is. If the locale is None the message is translated to the default locale. :returns: the translated message in unicode, or the original message if it could not be translated """ translated = message if isinstance(message, Message): original_locale = message.locale message.locale = user_locale translated = six.text_type(message) message.locale = original_locale return translated
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 from novaclient.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ import __builtin__ __builtin__.__dict__['_'] = _lazy_gettext gettext.install(domain, localedir=os.environ.get(localedir), unicode=True) self.locale = None lang.ugettext(self._msg) + params[key] = unicode(dict_param[key]) self.params = unicode(other) 'domain', 'params', 'locale'] # this check when the master list updates to >=1.0, and all projects udpate """Gets a localized version of the given message in the given locale.""" if isinstance(message, Message): if user_locale: message.locale = user_locale return unicode(message) else: return message

subject: Preserving older storage policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-28 16:18:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/6fe3505bbde6bdb3ef924e4d56663c291aa776a3', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy metadata during container replication.

Put timestamps are compared to determine age. When a container
receives a request to replicate from an older container with a
different storage policy, the older storage policy is adopted.
Container sync points are used in the rare event that two
containers share the same put_timestamp but different storage
policies

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class was created to accomplish the
above by wrapping a new sync() method around the original to
provide the additional funcionality and minimize impact to the
original sync() method.  When a policy mismatch occurs, the
metadata of the current container is updated with the older
storage policy. In addition, the stage is set for moving objects
from the new policy over to the old policy.

Suggestions for using something other than sync points when two
containers share the same put_timestamp are welcomed.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-28 16:25:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/74f22a204cd079c2ce1fa1912f7178e0766b98e2', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy metadata during container replication.

Put timestamps are compared to determine age. When a container
receives a request to replicate from an older container with a
different storage policy, the older storage policy is adopted.
Container sync points are used in the rare event that two
containers share the same put_timestamp but different storage
policies

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class was created to accomplish the
above by wrapping a new sync() method around the original to
provide the additional funcionality and minimize impact to the
original sync() method.  When a policy mismatch occurs, the
metadata of the current container is updated with the older
storage policy. In addition, the stage is set for moving objects
from the new policy over to the old policy.

Suggestions for using something other than sync points when two
containers share the same put_timestamp are welcomed.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-09-04 21:02:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a1972809a6e23b80747b4a001a97e1ab2de96e39', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication.

Put timestamps are compared to determine age. When a container
receives a request to replicate from an older container with a
different storage policy, the older storage policy is adopted.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class was created to accomplish the
above by wrapping a new sync() method around the original to
provide the additional funcionality and minimize impact to the
original sync() method.  When a policy mismatch occurs, the
metadata of the current container is updated with the older
storage policy index. In addition, the stage is set for moving
objects from the new policy over to the old policy.

In the rare case of containers sharing the same put_timestamp,
the highest storage policy index will be used.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2013-09-12 21:04:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/805005e33dc56df3f192e3593999d5092ac73424', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication.

Put timestamps are compared to determine age. When a container
receives a request to replicate from an older container with a
different storage policy, the older storage policy is adopted.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class was created to accomplish the
above by wrapping a new sync() method around the original to
provide the additional funcionality and minimize impact to the
original sync() method.  When a policy mismatch occurs, the
metadata of the current container is updated with the older
storage policy index. In addition, the stage is set for moving
objects from the new policy over to the old policy.

In the rare case of containers sharing the same put_timestamp,
the highest storage policy index will be used.

The original sync merges the newer of the two put_timestamps,
and the next iteration of db replication will view the containers
as the same age.  This is prevented by witholding the incoming
put_timestamp when the newer container has a different policy.

I have decided not to include the functional nose test for this
patch.  It really only works on a SAIO installation.  Containers
are created normally, but the db brokers are used to induce a
policy change. If we can come up with a better method of inducing
a policy change, I will be happy to include the functional nose
test later on.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication.

Created_at timestamps are compared to determine age. When a container
receives a request to replicate from an older container with a
different storage policy, the older storage policy is adopted.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class was created to accomplish the
above by wrapping a new sync() method around the original to
provide the additional funcionality and minimize impact to the
original sync() method.  When a policy mismatch occurs, the
metadata of the current container is updated with the older
storage policy index. In addition, the stage is set for moving
objects from the new policy over to the old policy.

In the rare case of containers sharing the same created_at,

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37
'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2013-11-08 17:20:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/47b322c778ad90e484e5d78a83bb4aa01f34758f', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication. This is
accomblished by modifying the method update_metadata of the
database broker and the creation of a ContainerReplicatorRpc
class.

The field "keep_older_meta" has been added to the database
broker and is empty by default. The subclass ContainerBroker
adds the storage policy index key to keep_older_meta. Update_metadata
only allows updates to keys inside of keep_older_meta when timestamps
are older or the same but the new value is greater. Unfortunately,
not having a storage policy index has meaning. We have to guard
against adding key/value pairs for keys in keep_older_meta to
existing containers that do not have those keys. We still need to
consider older containers without keys replicating with containers
with those keys.  Metadata alone is not enough.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class fulfills the second part. It houses
the method "pre_sync" which can be optionally called from the parent
class's original sync method. This removes the double request for
replication_info in the previous iterations of this change.
pre_sync() identifies policy differences providing a starting point
to move objects and handles the case where on older container without
a policy is replicating with a newer container with a policy.

This change assumes that guarding metadata keys in keep_older_meta
from updates when the keys are not already in the metadata is the
general case.  If it is not the general case, we can move what would
then be storage policy index only logic into pre_sync and "prepare"
the metadata before it gets to update_metadata.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37
'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2013-11-08 18:14:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/44d56615457b03666da959bc6135d1d8f1e92e13', 'message': 'Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication. This is
accomblished by modifying the method update_metadata of the
database broker and the creation of a ContainerReplicatorRpc
class.

The field "keep_older_meta" has been added to the database
broker and is empty by default. The subclass ContainerBroker
adds the storage policy index key to keep_older_meta. Update_metadata
only allows updates to keys inside of keep_older_meta when timestamps
are older or the same but the new value is greater. Unfortunately,
not having a storage policy index has meaning. We have to guard
against adding key/value pairs for keys in keep_older_meta to
existing containers that do not have those keys. We still need to
consider older containers without keys replicating with containers
with those keys.  Metadata alone is not enough.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class fulfills the second part. It houses
the method "pre_sync" which can be optionally called from the parent
class's original sync method. This removes the double request for
replication_info in the previous iterations of this change.
pre_sync() identifies policy differences providing a starting point
to move objects and handles the case where on older container without
a policy is replicating with a newer container with a policy.

This change assumes that guarding metadata keys in keep_older_meta
from updates when the keys are not already in the metadata is the
general case.  If it is not the general case, we can move what would
then be storage policy index only logic into pre_sync and "prepare"
the metadata before it gets to update_metadata.

broker and is empty by default. The subclass ContainerBroker
adds the storage policy index key to keep_older_meta. Update_metadata
only allows updates to keys inside of keep_older_meta when timestamps
are older or the same but the new value is greater. Unfortunately,
not having a storage policy index has meaning. We have to guard
against adding key/value pairs for keys in keep_older_meta to
existing containers that do not have those keys. We still need to
consider older containers without keys replicating with containers
with those keys.  Metadata alone is not enough.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class fulfills the second part. It houses
the method "pre_sync" which can be optionally called from the parent
class's original sync method. This removes the double request for

to move objects and handles the case where on older container without
a policy is replicating with a newer container with a policy.

from updates when the keys are not already in the metadata is the
general case.  If it is not the general case, we can move what would
then be storage policy index only logic into pre_sync and "prepare"
the metadata before it gets to update_metadata.

commit_message:
Preserving older storage policies

The intention of this change is to preserve older storage
policy index metadata during container replication. This is
accomblished by modifying the method update_metadata of the
database broker and the creation of a ContainerReplicatorRpc
class.

The field "keep_older_meta" has been added to the database
broker and is empty by default. The subclass ContainerBroker
adds the storage policy index key to keep_older_meta. Update_metadata
only allows updates to keys inside of keep_older_meta when timestamps
are older or the same but the new value is greater. Unfortunately,
not having a storage policy index has meaning. We have to guard
against adding key/value pairs for keys in keep_older_meta to
existing containers that do not have those keys. We still need to
consider older containers without keys replicating with containers
with those keys.  Metadata alone is not enough.

The ContainerReplicatorRpc class fulfills the second part. It houses
the method "pre_sync" which can be optionally called from the parent
class's original sync method. This removes the double request for
replication_info in the previous iterations of this change.
pre_sync() identifies policy differences providing a starting point
to move objects and handles the case where on older container without
a policy is replicating with a newer container with a policy.

This change assumes that guarding metadata keys in keep_older_meta
from updates when the keys are not already in the metadata is the
general case.  If it is not the general case, we can move what would
then be storage policy index only logic into pre_sync and "prepare"
the metadata before it gets to update_metadata.

Change-Id: Icdc3b12814a28f5ee408e841a28b0d9728c79a37

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2010-2012 OpenStack, LLC. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import unittest import simplejson from contextlib import contextmanager from swift.container.replicator_rpc import ContainerReplicatorRpc from swift.proxy.controllers.base import POLICY TEST_ACCOUNT_NAME = 'a c t' TEST_CONTAINER_NAME = 'c o n' DEFAULT_HASH = '' DEFAULT_ID = 1 DEFAULT_POLICY = 'some-policy' DIFF_POLICY = 'diff-policy' class FakeBroker: """ Taken from test_db_replicator. Mostly duplicated with some additional functions """ db_file = __file__ get_repl_missing_table = False stub_replication_info = None db_type = 'container' info = {'account': TEST_ACCOUNT_NAME, 'container': TEST_CONTAINER_NAME} def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): self.locked = False self.metadata = {POLICY: (DEFAULT_POLICY, 0)} return None @contextmanager def lock(self): self.locked = True yield True self.locked = False def get_sync(self, *args, **kwargs): return 5 def get_syncs(self): return [] def get_items_since(self, point, *args): if point == 0: return [{'ROWID': 1}] return [] def merge_syncs(self, *args, **kwargs): self.args = args def merge_items(self, *args): self.args = args def get_replication_info(self): if self.get_repl_missing_table: raise Exception('no such table') if self.stub_replication_info: return self.stub_replication_info return {'delete_timestamp': 0, 'put_timestamp': 1, 'count': 0, \ 'created_at': 0, 'hash': DEFAULT_HASH, 'point': 0} def reclaim(self, item_timestamp, sync_timestamp): pass def get_info(self): return self.info def update_metadata(self, metadata_updates): for key, value_timestamp in metadata_updates.iteritems(): value, timestamp = value_timestamp if key not in self.metadata or timestamp > self.metadata[key][1]: self.metadata[key] = value_timestamp def merge_timestamps(self, created_at, put_timestamp, delete_timestamp): pass class TestContainerReplicatorRpc(unittest.TestCase): """Unit tests for the ContainerReplicatorRpc class""" def setUp(self): """ Inits the test case with an instance of the ContainerReplicatorRpc class """ self.rpc = ContainerReplicatorRpc('/', '/', FakeBroker, False) def sync_args(self, remote_sync=0, created_at=0, put_timestamp=0, delete_timestamp=0, policy=DEFAULT_POLICY): """ Convenience method for creating a list of arguments to pass to sync() :param remote_sync: Default 0 :param create_at: Default 0 :param put_timestamp: Default 0 :param delete_timestamp: Default 0 :param policy: String storage policy. Default DEFAULT_POLICY :returns: List of arguments to send to sync() """ metadata = simplejson.dumps({POLICY: (policy, 0)}) return [remote_sync, DEFAULT_HASH, DEFAULT_ID, created_at, \ put_timestamp, delete_timestamp, metadata] def test_same_policy(self): """ Policies should not change when there is no difference. Tests that DEFAULT_POLICY is still the value for the POLICY key in the broker metadata """ broker = FakeBroker() policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) self.rpc.sync(broker, self.sync_args()) policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) def test_diff_policy_older(self): """ The older policy should be kept. Tests that when syncing with a newer container, the older container retains its policy. """ # Choose a put timestamp > FakeBroker's default timestamp args = self.sync_args(put_timestamp=10, policy=DIFF_POLICY) broker = FakeBroker() policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) self.rpc.sync(broker, args) self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) def test_diff_policy_newer(self): """ The older policy should be kept. Tests that when syncing with an older container, the newer container takes the policy of the older container. """ # Choose a timestamp < FakeBroker's default timestamp args = self.sync_args(put_timestamp=-1, policy=DIFF_POLICY) broker = FakeBroker() policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) self.rpc.sync(broker, args) policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DIFF_POLICY) def test_same_put_timestamps_diff_policies(self): """ Tests the behavior of when there is a policy difference but the put timestamps of each container are the same """ # Choose the same put timestamp args = self.sync_args(put_timestamp=1,remote_sync=3) broker = FakeBroker() # This container's policy should be kept in the event of a tie # And this container's sync point < less that the other container's policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) self.rpc.sync(broker, args) policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) # Choose a sync smaller than fake broker's default sync point broker = FakeBroker() args = self.sync_args(remote_sync=-1, policy=DIFF_POLICY) # This container should take the other container's policy # When the put timestamps are tied and the other container's # Sync point is smaller policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DEFAULT_POLICY) self.rpc.sync(broker, args) policy = broker.metadata[POLICY][0] self.assertEquals(policy, DIFF_POLICY)

commit_message:
Add parameter and iptables rules to protect dnsmasq ports

Add a paramater to the configuration file of the dhcp
agent. With this new param set as true, iptables rules
are inserted to limit dns requests to dnsmasq only to
the clients which are on the same subnet.

Change-Id: Iac3635326cb81d5de51b903510ff31cb6164aa86
Closes-bug: #1260731

commit_message:
Update requirements to 661e6

The requirements are updated to requirements project commit
661e6bad9e56dddd65a200dc08aedc00b9656312

 $ cd /opt/stack/requirements
 $ python update.py ../neutron

Closes-Bug: #1277583
Change-Id: I946d44725f3f0a283655cd8157c38d1b9410eac5

subject: Sync db.sqlalchemy module from Oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-04 23:49:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1768235e7e1643f218a9120335a4539db17122eb', 'message': 'Handle DB2 server disconnects pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temporary connection issue due
to network glitches.  At the moment only mysql is enabled with this
feature.  This patch enables DB2 as well.

Synced from Oslo change I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

Change-Id: I3844b48b680c754bbba8e1e8de70f784ed0b17ff
Partial-Bug: #1231657
