commit_message:
Sync db.sqlalchemy module from Oslo

Now that the fix for bug 1231657 has been integrated into
Oslo-incubator, I need to sync the db.sqlalchemy module
to bring the change over to Cinder.  This sync includes
the following commits:

Change 12bcdb71: Remove vim header
Change 31c19959: python3: Add python3 compatibility support
Change 1a2df89c: Enable H302 hacking check
Change 13a9e6dc: Import sqlalchemy session/models/utils
Change c5a10888: Typos fix in db and periodic_task module
Change 28f8fd5f: Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase
Change 484a1df3: Enable hacking H403 test
Change e6494c2b: Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3
Change 1dd49719: fix typo in db session docstring
Change 347f29e3: Use functools.wrap() instead of custom implementation
Change 489e2b73: Ensure that DB configuration is backward compatible
Change 7ba5f4b2: Don't use mixture of cfg.Opt() deprecated args
Change c2dcf6e8: Add [sql].connection as deprecated opt for db
Change ebaa5783: Enable user to configure pool_timeout
Change 444bdbcf: Add a slave db handle for the SQLAlchemy backend.
Change 7119e29c: Enable hacking H404 test.
Change 30cb47ee: Changed processing unique constraint name.
Change 3286ca90: Changed processing unique constraint name.
Change df3f2baf: BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
Change 001729df: Modify SQLA session due to dispose of eventlet
Change bb4d7a25: Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically
Change 3acd57c2: Add db2 communication error code when check the db connection
Change 0fe4e288: Use log.warning() instead of log.warn() in oslo.db
Change 2251cb58: Do not name variables as builtins
Change 3972c3f4: Migrate sqlalchemy utils from Nova
Change 3f2f70e0: Helper function to sanitize db url credentials
Change 5758360a: Raise ValueError if sort_dir is unknown
Change 135dd00c: Remove start index 0 in range()
Change 9721129f: exception: remove
Change c76be5bb: Add function drop_unique_constraint()
Change 56ff3b31: Use single meta when change column type

For reference, the commit that inspired this sync is:
Change bb4d7a25: Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

Change-Id: I3844b48b680c754bbba8e1e8de70f784ed0b17ff
Closes-Bug: #1231657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/49854/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsdef _ping_listener(engine, dbapi_conn, connection_rec, connection_proxy): Ensures that MySQL and DB2 connections checked out of the cursor = dbapi_conn.cursor() try: ping_sql = 'select 1' if engine.name == 'ibm_db_sa': # DB2 requires a table expression ping_sql = 'select 1 from (values (1)) AS t1' cursor.execute(ping_sql) except Exception as ex: if engine.dialect.is_disconnect(ex, dbapi_conn, cursor): msg = _('Database server has gone away: %s') % ex LOG.warn(msg) raise sqla_exc.DisconnectionError(msg) if connection_dict.drivername in ['mysql', 'ibm_db_sa']: callback = functools.partial(_ping_listener, engine) sqlalchemy.event.listen(engine, 'checkout', callback)
deleted_lines: def _ping_listener(dbapi_conn, connection_rec, connection_proxy): Ensures that MySQL connections checked out of the try: dbapi_conn.cursor().execute('select 1') except dbapi_conn.OperationalError as ex: if ex.args[0] in (2006, 2013, 2014, 2045, 2055): LOG.warn(_('Got mysql server has gone away: %s'), ex) raise sqla_exc.DisconnectionError("Database server went away") if 'mysql' in connection_dict.drivername: sqlalchemy.event.listen(engine, 'checkout', _ping_listener)

commit_message:
VMWare: session management refactor

introduce session diagnostic methods to Vim object.
Start the process of eliminating the need for the
SessionAPI object by folding its functions back
into the Vim object

Change-Id: Ie7069885a2af25e58b3195474532ece168255260
blueprint: vmware-soap-session-management
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/66377/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import urllib2from nova.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def soap_service_responding(self): """Returns true if VMware's SOAP service is responding Required Privileges: System.Anonymous :return: True if can talk to SOAP, false if improper response """ try: # NOTE(hartsocks): deliberately avoid the rest of the framework # to avoid having to debug unrelated components. service = self.client.service serviceInstance = service.RetrieveServiceContent("ServiceInstance") if serviceInstance: self._service_content = serviceInstance return True else: return False except suds.WebFault: LOG.warning(_("VMware: Network Connection Fault %s"), self._host_name, exc_info=True) return False def has_open_session(self): """Determine if there is a currently open session. Required Privileges: System.View :return: True if a session is open, False if no session found. """ if not self.soap_service_responding(): return False try: # NOTE(hartsocks): deliberately avoid the rest of the framework # to avoid having to debug unrelated components. service = self.client.service serviceInstance = self.get_service_content() # NOTE(hartsocks): CurrentTime is used instead of SessionIsActive # for compatibility with naked ESX and older vCenter servers. serverTime = service.CurrentTime(serviceInstance) except suds.WebFault: return False # NOTE(hartsocks): There is a failure mode where the vCenter user # does not have the privilege System.View on their account or the # user's session is stale or logged out by a system administrator # In these situation on some system, the time is returned as a # None object. This is rare but should be checked for. return serverTime is not None if (response and hasattr(error_util.FaultCheckers, attr_name.lower() + "_fault_checker")): except (urllib2.URLError, urllib2.HTTPError) as excep: raise error_util.SessionConnectionException(_("urllib2 " "error in %s: ") % (attr_name), excep)

commit_message:
Refactor tests/unit/test_shell.py

Some codes in this file are not used, and some tests are very weak.

This Fix improves the unittest by providing the ability to check
stdout and/or stderr output, also cleans some unused codes.

NOTE: This patch introduces new test-requirement: mock

Closes-Bug: #1210473
Change-Id: I5a890e944c1788fb815fb7b27c86368bab455eb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/15/41615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
def tearDown(self): self.mox.UnsetStubs() super(ShellTest, self).tearDown() def shell(self, argstr, stdout_match=None, stderr_match=None): _stdout, _stderr = cStringIO.StringIO(), cStringIO.StringIO() self.patch(sys, 'stdout', _stdout) self.patch(sys, 'stderr', _stderr) try: if stdout_match: self.assertThat(_stdout.getvalue(), stdout_match) if stderr_match: self.assertThat(_stderr.getvalue(), stderr_match) expected_err = "Unknown command ['fake']
" _matcher = matchers.Equals(expected_err) self.shell('fake', stderr_match=_matcher) _matcher = matchers.MatchesRegex(required) self.shell('help', stdout_match=_matcher) expected = '.*?^usage: .* quota-list' _matcher = matchers.MatchesRegex(expected, re.DOTALL | re.MULTILINE) self.shell('help quota-list', stdout_match=_matcher) expected_err = ('You must provide a service URL via either ' '--os-url or env[OS_URL]
') _matcher = matchers.Equals(expected_err) self.shell('--os-auth-strategy fake quota-list', stderr_match=_matcher) # TODO(zqfan): can be improved with using fake api to handle req expected_err = ('Connection to neutron failed: [Errno 111] ' 'Connection refused
') ' --os-auth-strategy keystone quota-list', stderr_match=matchers.Equals(expected_err)) self.assertTrue(isinstance(result, argparse.ArgumentParser)) shell_mock = openstack_shell.NeutronShell('2.0') argv = ['net-list', unicode_text.encode('utf-8')] shell_mock.run(['net-list', unicode_text]).AndReturn(0)
deleted_lines: import osfrom neutronclient.common import exceptionsclass NoExitArgumentParser(argparse.ArgumentParser): def error(self, message): raise exceptions.CommandError(message) def _tolerant_shell(self, cmd): t_shell = openstack_shell.NeutronShell('2.0') t_shell.run(cmd.split()) # Make a fake shell object, a helping wrapper to call it, and a quick # way of asserting that certain API calls were made. global shell, _shell, assert_called, assert_called_anytime _shell = openstack_shell.NeutronShell('2.0') shell = lambda cmd: _shell.run(cmd.split()) def shell(self, argstr): orig = sys.stdout clean_env = {} _old_env, os.environ = os.environ, clean_env.copy() try: sys.stdout = cStringIO.StringIO() finally: out = sys.stdout.getvalue() sys.stdout.close() sys.stdout = orig os.environ = _old_env return out openstack_shell.NeutronShell('2.0').run('fake') help_text = self.shell('help') self.assertThat( help_text, matchers.MatchesRegex(required)) required = [ '.*?^usage: .* quota-list'] stdout = self.shell('help quota-list') for r in required: self.assertThat( stdout, matchers.MatchesRegex(r, re.DOTALL | re.MULTILINE)) def test_help_command(self): required = 'usage:' help_text = self.shell('help network-create') self.assertThat( help_text, matchers.MatchesRegex(required)) self.shell('--os-auth-strategy fake quota-list') ' --os-auth-strategy keystone quota-list') self.assertEqual(True, isinstance(result, argparse.ArgumentParser)) qshell_mock = openstack_shell.NeutronShell('2.0') #self.mox.StubOutWithMock(qshell_mock, 'run') argv = ['net-list', unicode_text, unicode_text.encode('utf-8')] qshell_mock.run([u'net-list', unicode_text, unicode_text]).AndReturn(0) self.mox.UnsetStubs()

commit_message:
Migrate oslo.messaging options to [oslo_messaging] config group

To help isolate configuration options from the main (application)
configuration opts registered, migrate the oslo.messaging specific
options to their own configuration group. All options have had
an explicit Deprecated option programatically added for the original
location in [DEFAULT] option group.

added_lines: from solum.api.controllers.v1.datamodel import plan as planmodel from solum import objects from solum.openstack.common import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) objects.load() @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(planmodel.Plan, wtypes.text) db_obj = objects.registry.Plan.get_by_id(None, self._id) if db_obj is None: error = _("Plan not found") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error), status_code=404) return planmodel.Plan.from_db_object(db_obj) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(planmodel.Plan, wtypes.text, body=planmodel.Plan) db_obj = objects.registry.Plan.get_by_id(None, self._id) if db_obj is None: error = _("Plan not found") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error), status_code=404) data.to_db_object(db_obj) db_obj.save() db_obj = objects.registry.Plan.get_by_id(None, self._id) if db_obj is None: error = _("Plan not found") pecan.response.translatable_error = error raise wsme.exc.ClientSideError(six.text_type(error), status_code=404) db_obj.delete() @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(planmodel.Plan, body=planmodel.Plan, status_code=201) db_obj = objects.registry.Plan() data.to_db_object(db_obj) db_obj.create() return planmodel.Plan.from_db_object(db_obj) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([planmodel.Plan]) return [planmodel.Plan.from_db_object(obj) for obj in objects.registry.PlanList.get_all(None)]

commit_message:
Assembly DB schema and object model

Added:
- Assembly DB schema and object model.
- tests for the assembly schema change.

Co-Authored: Angus Salkeld <angus.salkeld@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I127556c44643c3e123f94ec935f9e52616c7f310

"""Add assembly Revision ID: 3f2eaf30c19f Revises: a42f578cef8 Create Date: 2014-01-27 13:46:44.008458 """ from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '3f2eaf30c19f' down_revision = 'a42f578cef8' def upgrade(): op.create_table( 'assembly', sa.Column('id', sqlalchemy.String(36), primary_key=True, nullable=False), sa.Column('created_at', sa.DateTime, default=timeutils.utcnow), sa.Column('updated_at', sa.DateTime, onupdate=timeutils.utcnow), sa.Column('deleted_at', sa.DateTime), sa.Column('deleted', sa.Integer, default=0), sa.Column('name', sa.String(100)), sa.Column('type', sa.String(100)), sa.Column('description', sa.String(255)), sa.Column('project_id', sa.String(36)), sa.Column('user_id', sa.String(36)), sa.Column('operations_uri', sa.String(255)), sa.Column('sensor_uri', sa.String(255)), ) def downgrade(): op.drop_tables('assembly')

commit_message:
Enable simple modification of git repo location

Add the DIB_GITREPOBASE variable to the source-repositories element
to enable global changing of git repository location.

Change-Id: Icfac5e103fce6e5a3f1a2db094144a0ed89fcc33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/91/74791/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "${DIB_GITREPOBASE}" ] ; then # Transform the current repo base to the new one local NEW_REPOLOCATION=$(echo $REPOLOCATION |\ sed "s,^[^:]\+://[^/]\+/\(~[^/]\+\)\?\(.*\)$,${DIB_GITREPOBASE}\2,g") echo "Transformed ${REPOLOCATION} to ${NEW_REPOLOCATION}" REPOLOCATION=$NEW_REPOLOCATION fi

commit_message:
Generalize install-packages for yum

All of the yum-based install-packages scripts are doing essentially
the same thing, so let's use one script for all of the elements
that depend on the yum element.

Change-Id: I49e8c9b44e41bcf4cb9fa820e8a9179754694a97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/65/74865/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. yum -y updateelif [ "$1" = "-d" ] ; then EXTRA_ARGS="--downloadonly" shiftBLACKLIST=$(cat /tmp/yum-blacklist 2>/dev/null || echo "") for pkg in "$@"; do if [ "$pkg" = "python-pip" ] ; then alternatives --install /usr/bin/pip pip /usr/bin/pip-python 10 fi done
deleted_lines: # Update packages for the distro #yum -y updateBLACKLIST=(ccache dkms)

commit_message:
Enable custom apt.conf in apt-conf element

Allow DIB_APT_CONF to be set to the apt.conf file to be inserted
into the built images.

Change-Id: I5d148ae7286a93e81b3e984c94ba4f089d3a3280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/92/74992/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Override the default apt.conf For Ubuntu OS, if you require specific options for apt operations, you can define DIB\_APT\_CONF with your favorite apt.conf to override it, before running devtest.sh. The new apt.conf will take effect at build time and run time. If you want to use this element in tripleo project, set NODE\_DIST or EXTRA\_ELEMENTS / UNDERCLOUD\_DIB\_EXTRA\_ARGS / OVERCLOUD\_DIB\_EXTRA\_ARGS to make it take effect at build time and run time. e.g. before running devtest.sh: export DIB\_APT\_CONF=/etc/apt/apt.conf export NODE\_DIST="ubuntu apt-conf"

commit_message:
SignalResponder move signed URL deleting to its own method

Subclasses may not be handling this in their handle_delete
methods

Change-Id: I3dbb89e0a86690617613b25c9533bbf52d1da8a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/05/74205/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._delete_signed_url() def _delete_signed_url(self): pass

subject: REST deployment metadata method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 00:18:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/18c079a459e4ffbe1014f795ebe53a0b71b024ee', 'message': 'REST deployment metadata method

A GET on the path /software_deployments/metadata/<server_id>
will return a grouped collection of deployments.

See the previous commit for the justification for this method.

In the future servers will be able to poll for this directly so
the policy.json does not have the deny_stack_user rule. Now that
this method exists software_deployments:index can now enforce
deny_stack_user.

commit_message:
REST deployment metadata method

A GET on the path /software_deployments/metadata/<server_id>
will return a list of software configs which should be deployed
to that server.

See the previous commit for the justification for this method.

In the future servers will be able to poll for this directly so
the policy.json does not have the deny_stack_user rule. Now that
this method exists software_deployments:index can now enforce
deny_stack_user.

partial blueprint hot-software-config-rest

deployed to a given server. Each config has the deployment input values
and current action inserted into it. This means that each config is
ephemeral and derived from the canonical config specified in the deployment
resource. The list of configs is sorted by config name. This allows the
template to control what order the configs are returned by setting the

that servers will eventually be able to poll for deployment metadata directly,

commit_message:
RPC method to fetch deployments metadata

This method returns a list of software configs which are currently
deployed to a given server. Each config has the deployment input values
and current action inserted into it. This means that each config is
ephemeral and derived from the canonical config specified in the deployment
resource. The list of configs is sorted by config name. This allows the
template to control what order the configs are returned by setting the
'name' attribute of each deployment resource.

Having a separate RPC (and REST) method for deployment metadata also means
that servers will eventually be able to poll for deployment metadata directly,
avoiding the need to parse the stack for every poll.

partial blueprint hot-software-config-rest

commit_message:
Raise NotFound in software_config_get/software_deployment_get

This change results in the required behaviour of show_software_config
and show_software_deployment which will now also raising NotFound if
no entity with the ID was found.

commit_message:
Remove broken quota-classes API

It turns out os-quota-classes-sets never worked
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-February/027574.html). Since this doesn't work no need to keep it around.

V3 removal: Id1f288baa723df825151bd84aa27089271c2b8e4
Original commit: I6b6477481187d16af225d33c1989430e4071d5a8

This patch just removes the API it doesn't remove the quota-class
internals, that will be done in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I1110022d6f628d03aaf363da707f2d2ef1600437

commit_message:
Ensure MTU is set when the OVS vif driver is used

Set the MTU on the relevant devices when the OVS vif driver
is used:
    - veth devices
    - ovs vif device

Closes-bug: 1260697

Conflicts:

	nova/network/linux_net.py

Change-Id: I217f43227c099f17ab9a225b1ef7377d3de28114

commit_message:
Stop trying to create the 'ironic' user twice

After 09bd7c8fd5a6 landed, a conflict between lib/ironic and
extras.d/50-ironic.sh was exposed, breaking Ironic's check and gate
tests.

This resolves that conflict by only creating the 'ironic' user once.

Change-Id: Ic41517f0977c84a82f92f58565aaee6b5cc7eb3e

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer parse invalid year num timestamp

iso8601 should raise reasonable error when parsing timestamp with invalid
years. this is implemented in iso8601 version 0.1.9.
More details please see the bug description and the issue on bitbucket.

Change-Id: Ied7d1878b26b2edaf37a9b5fc0b468ebfa2cb0e7
Closes-Bug: #1266398

commit_message:
Add NoSQL database support for metering.

- Add two attributes to indicate whether NoSQL is used for metering
  database and the port used for NoSQL database.
- When database type is DB2, only NoSQL is supported and the SQL
  connection is not same to the one SQLAlchemy-based.

Change-Id: Icff805cee8e078f99ff46a59e290da60d2f9bb29

commit_message:
Point to correct lbaas_agent.ini file

On CentOS / Ubuntu, lbaas agent fails to start as we drop in a config
in a non-standard location.  The stock distro-provided config is also
problematic as it doesn't have a default interface_driver set which
prevents the service from starting.

This change defaults all distros to use /etc/neutron/lbaas_agent.ini
and tidies up ownership/mode of the dropped file.

Change-Id: I919e535989c5ec05ee196235fbd528eb971cbb05
Closes-Bug: #1283237

commit_message:
Fix format errors in nova security group rule list

* port range was throwing exception for None to/from ports
* ip_range didn't always have cidr causing error
* ip_protocol None at times and looked bad

Closes-Bug #1256935

Change-Id: I451a0f038a3e9646bca3f278c5d6f6d7e3097a83

added_lines: from_port = info.pop('from_port') to_port = info.pop('to_port') if isinstance(from_port, int) and isinstance(to_port, int): port_range = {'port_range': "%u:%u" % (from_port, to_port)} elif from_port is None and to_port is None: port_range = {'port_range': ""} else: port_range = {'port_range': "%s:%s" % (from_port, to_port)} info.update(port_range) if 'cidr' in info['ip_range']: info['ip_range'] = info['ip_range']['cidr'] else: info['ip_range'] = '' elif info['ip_protocol'] is None: info['ip_protocol'] = ''

subject: Handle racing condition in OFC port deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 12:59:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f1148951b1d459d5337b834b01a0ec3ccbc50741', 'message': 'Handle racing condition in OFC port deletion

Multiple delete_port operations can run in parallel.
For such case later operation(s) will receive 404 (NotFound)
error from OFC or NotResultFound sqlalchemy exception.
These are valid exceptions and they should be ignored
in delete_port operations.

Closes-Bug: #1281574

OFCConsistencyBroken is renamed to OFCMappingNotFound
because when multiple delete_port operations run in parallel
OFCConsistencyBroken can occur and it is a valid case
so the excepion name looks inappropriate.

commit_message:
Handle racing condition in OFC port deletion

Multiple delete_port operations can run in parallel.
For such case later operation(s) will receive 404 (NotFound)
error from OFC or NotResultFound sqlalchemy exception.
These are valid exceptions and they should be ignored
in delete_port operations.

Closes-Bug: #1281574

OFCConsistencyBroken is renamed to OFCMappingNotFound
because when multiple delete_port operations run in parallel
OFCConsistencyBroken can occur and it is a valid case
so the excepion name looks inappropriate.

Change-Id: I1511d55994c88b8828f0ff62610c18ddc6dfac8f

commit_message:
Convert AccessKey resource to attributes_schema

Update the AccessKey resource so it uses the attributes schema
interface, which will enable attributes docs to be generated.

Change-Id: Ide86840f3d11f05811168f71103aa3281315b964
Closes-Bug: #1263743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/75/76275/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: attributes_schema = { 'UserName': _('Username associated with the AccessKey.'), 'SecretAccessKey': _('Keypair secret key.'), } def _resolve_attribute(self, name): if name == 'UserName': return self.properties[self.USER_NAME] elif name == 'SecretAccessKey': return self._secret_accesskey()
deleted_lines: def FnGetAtt(self, key): res = None log_res = None if key == 'UserName': res = self.properties[self.USER_NAME] log_res = res elif key == 'SecretAccessKey': res = self._secret_accesskey() log_res = "<SANITIZED>" else: raise exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute( resource=self.physical_resource_name(), key=key) logger.info('%s.GetAtt(%s) == %s' % (self.physical_resource_name(), key, log_res)) return unicode(res)

commit_message:
TSM backup driver changes to support file backup

Extend TSM backup driver to support backup of file based volumes,
as well as restore and delete of the backups.  This in addition
to the current block based volume support.  This involves determining
the type of volume this is requested to be backed up, and modifying
the dsmc command options accordingly.  When a volume is backed
up, the backup mode and backup path are saved in the backup
service_metadata for use on restore and delete operations.

This commit includes some further refactoring based on pylint
feedback and system testing.

Implements: blueprint tsm-backup-driver-enhancement
Change-Id: Ic994a8c2f7302e59358dd858b50df746c9a7d76f

commit_message:
Add optional ionice to volume clearing process

Allow the volume clearing process to have an ionice priority set to
reduce the performance impact of volume zeroing. Note that this may
cause volume clearing processes to get backed up on  a busy system, use
with care.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I2d556f57aaca8a8ccc6f0f767f1cec28c3f9bc86
Implements: blueprint when-deleting-volume-dd-performance

commit_message:
Set umask

Ensure we have a known-good umask.  Otherwise files such as
/etc/polkit-1/rules.d/50-libvirt-$STACK_USER.rules may not be readable
by non-root users afterwards.

Also reworded some comments to be more clear.

Change-Id: I7653d4eee062cf32df22aa158da6269b1aa9a558
Closes-Bug: #1265195

If you are crafty you can run the script on multiple nodes # using shared settings for common resources (eg., mysql or rabbitmq) and build # a multi-node developer install.# Make sure umask is sane umask 022

commit_message:
Fix libvirt polkit settings

After the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75314 merged
the /etc/polkit-1/rules.d/50-libvirt-stack.rules files contains
subject.user == '"stack"' instead of
subject.user == 'stack'.

Change-Id: I09f252b2d0e53f012facb9f7eaa21c1e1bdf492b

subject: Don't clear host_state_map when scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 02:36:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/be340fbd74e0778e04c6e96210947cdb9379fdef', 'message': "Don't clear host_state_map when scheduling

host_state_map was added to scheduler for the purpose of caching latest
host_state in memory for scheduler.  With this cache, scheduler has the
latest host_state (e.g. free_capacity, allocated_capacity, etc) of hosts
even hosts haven't reported their updated status to scheduler.

Unfortunately, this cache is flushed when scheduling pulling all available
volume services from DB in current implementation, which is a bug.

This change remove the host_state_map.clear() so that scheduler is able to
maintain an up-to-date (well, mostly) view of all volume services in memory.
Also, added code to remove non-active host from the cache every time when
scheduler handles a new request.  Multi-line docstrings in cinder/scheduler/
host_manager.py are also fixed.

Change-Id: Ib47be483fa26631a1483721e2ae6d972994e150f
Fixes-bug: 1271162
"}]
commit_message:
Don't clear host_state_map when scheduling

host_state_map was added to scheduler for the purpose of caching latest
host_state in memory for scheduler.  With this cache, scheduler has the
latest host_state (e.g. free_capacity, allocated_capacity, etc) of hosts
even hosts haven't reported their updated status to scheduler.

Unfortunately, this cache is flushed when scheduling pulling all available
volume services from DB in current implementation, which is a bug.

This change remove the host_state_map.clear() so that scheduler is able to
maintain an up-to-date (well, mostly) view of all volume services in memory.
Also, added code to remove non-active host from the cache every time when
scheduler handles a new request.  Multi-line docstrings in cinder/scheduler/
host_manager.py are also fixed.

Change-Id: Ib47be483fa26631a1483721e2ae6d972994e150f
Fixes-bug: 1271162

added_lines: """Return a list of available filter names. This function checks input filter names against a predefined set of acceptable filterss (all loaded filters). This function checks input weigher names against a predefined set of acceptable weighers (all loaded weighers). If input is None, it uses CONF.scheduler_default_weighers instead. """Returns a dict of all the hosts the HostManager knows about. Each of the consumable resources in HostState are populated with capabilities scheduler received from RPC. For example: active_hosts = set() # update attributes in host_state that scheduler is interested in active_hosts.add(host) # remove non-active hosts from host_state_map nonactive_hosts = set(self.host_state_map.keys()) - active_hosts for host in nonactive_hosts: LOG.info(_("Removing non-active host: %(host)s from " "scheduler cache.") % {'host': host}) del self.host_state_map[host]

commit_message:
Fix usage of novaclient update aggregate

Now novaclient aggregate-update usage is:

nova aggregate-update [--name <name>]
                      [--availability_zone <availability-zone>]
                      <aggregate>

so fix aggregates exercises to match it.

Change-Id: I0e8763596fc52bf25e7e8c834cac6fdcc03b4d3d
Closes-bug: #1285630

commit_message:
Improve local-config proxy handling.

We were applying proxy settings after apt-get install runs are done
in the Ubuntu element, which made it ineffective. Secondly, we were
not applying no_proxy settings to apt, which caused it to fail in
corporate settings. More explicit control may be facilitated in future
but local-config is a DTRT tool, and so we should help it DTRT.

I think I've correctly setup Zypper for this, and I have no idea
how to make the same improvement for Yum (and also Yum currently
doesn't set HTTPS proxies, which may lead to similar reports there).

Change-Id: Idbb9781d64d44b717ea22a25429383fa45d84148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/36/76636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Save the HTTP/[S] and noproxy settings if available. # XXX: Obviously not suitable for downloadable images. set -e set -o xtrace if [ -d /etc/apt ] ; then have_apt=1 fi if [ -e /etc/yum.conf ] ; then have_yum=1 fi if [ -d /etc/zypp ] ; then have_zypper=1 fi if [ -n "$http_proxy" ]; then if [ -d ~stack ]; then echo export http_proxy=$http_proxy >> ~stack/.profile fi if [ -n "$have_apt" ] ; then echo "Acquire::http::Proxy \"$http_proxy\";" > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/02-use-http-proxy fi if [ -n "$have_yum" ] ; then sed -i -e "s,\[main\],[main]\nproxy=$http_proxy," /etc/yum.conf fi if [ -n "$have_zypper" ] ; then sed -i -e "s,^HTTP_PROXY=.*$,HTTP_PROXY=\"$http_proxy\"," /etc/sysconfig/proxy fi fi if [ -n "$https_proxy" ]; then if [ -d ~stack ]; then echo export https_proxy=$https_proxy >> ~stack/.profile fi if [ -n "$have_apt" ] ; then echo "Acquire::https::Proxy \"$https_proxy\";" > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/02-use-https-proxy fi if [ -n "$have_zypper" ] ; then sed -i -e "s,^HTTPS_PROXY=.*$,HTTPS_PROXY=\"$https_proxy\"," /etc/sysconfig/proxy fi fi no_proxy=${no_proxy:+"$no_proxy,192.0.2.1"} no_proxy=${no_proxy:-"192.0.2.1"} if [ -n "$no_proxy" ]; then if [ -d ~stack ]; then echo export no_proxy=$no_proxy >> ~stack/.profile fi if [ -n "$have_apt" ] ; then for host in $(sed 's/,/ /g' <<<$no_proxy); do echo "Acquire::http::Proxy::$host \"DIRECT\";" >> /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/02-no-proxy done fi if [ -n "$have_zypper" ] ; then sed -i -e "s,^\(NO_PROXY=.*\)\"$,\1\, $no_proxy\"," /etc/sysconfig/proxy fi fi if [ -n "$http_proxy" -o -n "$https_proxy" -o -n "$no_proxy" ]; then if [ -n "$have_zypper" ] ; then sed -i -e "s,^PROXY_ENABLED=.*$,PROXY_ENABLED=\"yes\"," /etc/sysconfig/proxy fi fi

commit_message:
Add support for tenant_id based authentication with Neutron

Keystone v3 supports non-unique project/tenant names, so
Nova should switch to using tenant ID for admin authentication.

Implements blueprint tenant-id-based-auth-for-neutron
DocImpact: Adds new flag, nova_admin_tenant_id, and deprecates
existing flag, nova_admin_tenant_name

Change-Id: I4a4ffe84fdcf98ace81fd148f096cad483aad96c

commit_message:
update test to handle IntegerField html change

With Django 1.6, the html output for IntegerField in django.forms
has changed. Providing a test to check for earlier Django versions
as well as Django 1.6.

Partially-implements blueprint django-1point6

Change-Id: If4e544788306e07b268a9ebb67a3284bc8879f26

commit_message:
Export and import backup service metadata

Add new admin API for backup-export and backup-import.
The new commands export the backup details (not actual backup) to
a string that can be imported again in another OpenStack cloud or
if the backup database was corrupted.
The code includes a default backup driver implementation.
Backup test code converted to use mock.

blueprint cinder-backup-recover-api
DocImpact new admin API calls backup-import and backup-export

Change-Id: I564194929962e75c67630e73d8711ee6587706d4

commit_message:
NSX: port status must reflect fabric, not link status

This patch ensures the status attribute for the port resource is
semantically consistent with the reference plugin when using the
NSX plugin.

Change-Id: Ifb9c7664da926d3e6d5c6ec7c0e375b53a97582a
Closes-Bug: 1285426
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/16/76716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: NSX: Pass NSX uuid when plugging l2 gw attachment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 22:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/caa4ccd5d75626b390bb071e10367935f2878880', 'message': 'NSX: Pass NSX uuid when plugging l2 gw attachment

The code passed the neutron network identifier.
This is no longer valid as identifiers on the backend are not
anymore the same as neutron identifiers.

Also, this would have hardly worked with networks on extended
logical switches.

Closes-Bug: 1285399
Change-Id: I6fe4d22d5b8d8b7dc3eb1cb3f47ad52ac1a2b565
'}]
commit_message:
NSX: Pass NSX uuid when plugging l2 gw attachment

The code passed the neutron network identifier.
This is no longer valid as identifiers on the backend are not
anymore the same as neutron identifiers.

Also, this would have hardly worked with networks on extended
logical switches.

Closes-Bug: 1285399
Change-Id: I6fe4d22d5b8d8b7dc3eb1cb3f47ad52ac1a2b565

subject: Make admin_bind_host configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-24 18:43:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/041fa712472d887550a540dd50ade546f847c6b4', 'message': 'Make admin_bind_host configurable

The use case is running devstack inside an OpenStack vm and running tempest
from some other machine. To make the catalog export urls that can be accessed
from off the devstack machine, you need to set KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST to an
external IP. But devstack uses that address in its setup of keystone in
addition to exporting in the catalog. Because OpenStack has an issue where
a vm cannot access itself through its own floating ip, devstack fails. There
is no way to have this use case by providing an ip address. The workaround
is to use the hostname of the devstack machine. That worked until recently
when a change was made to set admin_bind_host to the value of
KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST. The result is that port 35357 is only opened locally.
This change allows the devstack user to restore the original behavior
allowing this use case.

Change-Id: I97b938b305b7dd878397e7e64462650064e59cd2
Closes-Bug: #1283803
'}]
commit_message:
Make admin_bind_host configurable

The use case is running devstack inside an OpenStack vm and running tempest
from some other machine. To make the catalog export urls that can be accessed
from off the devstack machine, you need to set KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST to an
external IP. But devstack uses that address in its setup of keystone in
addition to exporting in the catalog. Because OpenStack has an issue where
a vm cannot access itself through its own floating ip, devstack fails. There
is no way to have this use case by providing an ip address. The workaround
is to use the hostname of the devstack machine. That worked until recently
when a change was made to set admin_bind_host to the value of
KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST. The result is that port 35357 is only opened locally.
This change allows the devstack user to restore the original behavior
allowing this use case.

Change-Id: I97b938b305b7dd878397e7e64462650064e59cd2
Closes-Bug: #1283803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/54/75954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Bind hosts KEYSTONE_ADMIN_BIND_HOST=${KEYSTONE_ADMIN_BIND_HOST:-$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST} iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF DEFAULT admin_bind_host "$KEYSTONE_ADMIN_BIND_HOST"

commit_message:
Updated apt dependency to 2.3.8 to match openstack-common dependency

This was merged without bumping the Berksfile here, so it breaks to Vagrant run.
https://github.com/stackforge/cookbook-openstack-common/blob/master/metadata.rb#L18

Change-Id: Idfd0e9f6d0d8c06b3889f397267d1553f5fa1e77

added_lines: cookbook 'apt', '2.3.8'

Change-Id: I8b93f96239fb4f221f165916ecc65c893f33c7ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add a thread worker

Instead of requiring the worker users to wrap a worker
in a thread (a common case) just provide a worker sub
class that already does this wrapping to make it easy
to start workers.

Change-Id: I8b93f96239fb4f221f165916ecc65c893f33c7ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/06/76406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threading class ThreadWorker(Worker): """A worker that starts in a thread.""" def __init__(self, exchange, topic, tasks, executor=None, **kwargs): super(ThreadWorker, self).__init__(exchange, topic, tasks, executor=executor, **kwargs) self._manager = threading.Thread(target=self.run) def start(self): """Start the threads activity.""" self._manager.start() def join(self): """Wait until the thread terminates.""" self._manager.join()

commit_message:
Use Posix IPC in lockutils

Rather than creating temporary files in a file system let's leverage the
Posix IPC interface to create our inter process locking mechanism.

Blueprint: lockutils-posix-ipc

Change-Id: Ia87c3bdad64f0b0f6cb9fc2878add3fd1708041f

commit_message:
Remove db query from deallocate_fixed_ip

A previous patch updated deallocate_for_instance() in nova-network to
take the full instance object over rpc.  This patch passes that instance
through nova-network to deallocate_fixed_ip(), which allows us to avoid
N instance db lookups (where N is the number of fixed IPs being
deallocated).

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: Ib92e824f1bea2caae668945fabfae997632cd5f0

commit_message:
Savanna: use heat infra engine if available

In Savanna we have two provisioning engines:

* "savanna" that directly work with nova/neutron/glance/cinder/etc and
   we'd like to deprecate it early in Juno release cycle, but it's still
   useful due to the fact that it could work ok w/o Heat;
* "heat" engine uses Heat for provisioning of cluster resources, it's
   currently under active development and we're ready to make it default
   for OpenStack installations with enabled Heat.

Change-Id: I937337b3921e9e51768a118fb4b6bd95962622bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/03/76103/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled heat; then iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT infrastructure_engine heat else iniset $SAVANNA_CONF_FILE DEFAULT infrastructure_engine savanna fi

commit_message:
Fix NSX migration path

The migration path for the NSX plugin was not working correctly,
as two migrations (extra route and network gateways) were
skipped.
Therefore installations were partially relying on automatic
schema generation.

This patch fixes the migration path, as well as an attribute
whose name in the migration and the DB model differed.

Closes-Bug: 1285095

Change-Id: I9e4db294e618d1419d86e07cfb5505dcc01b54ca

commit_message:
Enable flake8 with tox

Devstack has not only shell scripts but also python tools. So we should
check whether the code keep the hacking rules.

This commit just enables flake8 checking with tox. But it ignores most
of the rules for keeping patches small.

Change-Id: I56bd516e23eebedc4d3ad66fcc514bdca008e1c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/18/75818/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] envlist = pep8 minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = True [testenv] install_command = pip install {opts} {packages} [testenv:pep8] commands = flake8 {posargs} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt [flake8] ignore = E,H,F show-source = True exclude = .git,.tox,files

commit_message:
Changed get_node_groups to receive only one node process

Ability to receive either string or list of strings makes code
hard to understand. Noone uses feature with list. So, removed it.

Closes-Bug: #1284402
Change-Id: I0d02321dc076f81769562378eb5e483dbc6c5565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/23/73723/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_node_groups(cluster, node_process=None): if node_process is None or node_process in ng.node_processes] def get_node_group(cluster, node_process=None): node_groups = get_node_groups(cluster, node_process) return node_groups[0] if node_groups else None def get_instances(cluster, node_process=None): nodes = get_node_groups(cluster, node_process)
deleted_lines: def get_node_groups(cluster, proc_list=list()): proc_list = [proc_list] if type(proc_list) in [str, unicode] else proc_list if set(proc_list).issubset(ng.node_processes)] def get_instances(cluster, proc_list=list()): nodes = get_node_groups(cluster, proc_list)

in it.

commit_message:
Update the neutron.conf.erb according to the latest ver from upstream.

- Move the database section into neutron.conf from plugins
- Make the service_provider attribute configurable

Implements: blueprint neutron-ml2
Change-Id: Ia9e932a490e5c13ba49aa8358356e2fa640b845c

commit_message:
Ensure pip_install failure is fatal

If pip_install fails it is sure that dependencies will be missing,
leading to (often) bizarre looking errors much later on.  Thus such a
failure should be fatal to the ongoing operation of devstack.

Change-Id: I0f4a2988e0601812ca373cc3bffc8c7dc3549695
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/75750/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "pip install failed, can not continue" fi

commit_message:
get_user_home test fix for django 1.6

In django 1.6, the django.utils.html.strip_tags method no longer
calls force_text on the object passed in.  This causes a
get_user_home test to fail as it attempts to concatenate the User
object and a str and fails.  Changing to a method that will take
an Object.

Change-Id: If879a1597fe334f67a3f7109defa0694db005f81
Partially-implements: blueprint django-1point6

commit_message:
Replace '+' with string interpolation operation

Replace string concatenation of translated messages with string
interpolation operation, since the gettextutils.Message object
doesn't support the '+' operation, which will cause problem when
lazy translation is enalbed.

Change-Id: I2c8a271ef766ab0da81b1c320870bbc429f6207e

commit_message:
Added more sample output for verification assistance.

Added output from user-role-list which helps with verifying that
the correct role is assigned to the correct user for the related
tenant.

Change-Id: I3d607ce389e72b9137d3d84a11c90fe8df2cc9b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/00/76800/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-role-list</userinput> <computeroutput>+----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+ | id | name | user_id | tenant_id | +----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+ | 9fe2ff9ee4384b1894a90878d3e92bab | _member_ | a4c2d43f80a549a19864c89d759bb3fe | e519b772cb43474582fa303da62559e5 | | 5d3b60b66f1f438b80eaae41a77b5951 | admin | a4c2d43f80a549a19864c89d759bb3fe | e519b772cb43474582fa303da62559e5 | +----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+</computeroutput></screen> <para>Seeing that the <literal>id</literal> in the output from the <command>keystone user-list</command> command matches the <literal>user_id</literal> in the <command>keystone user-role-list</command> command, and that the admin role is listed for that user, for the related tenant, this verifies that your user account has the <literal>admin</literal> role, which matches the role used in the Identity Service <filename>policy.json</filename>
deleted_lines: <para>This verifies that your user account has the <literal>admin</literal> role, which matches the role used in the Identity Service <filename>policy.json</filename>

commit_message:
Trunk install guide is now icehouse!

This change updates package lists to be icehouse, rather than
havana. Some of these work, others do not. All will be worked
out during https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IcehouseDocTesting

Removes a havana-specific paragraph for OpenSUSE

Change-Id: I59cab2d83695923e6b10ca60cdcf7a7fab55026e

subject: Add a caching scheduler driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 15:15:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/be033e082d557357358409fb389b78c9ce5868df', 'message': 'Add a caching scheduler driver

This adds a new scheduler driver, CachingScheduler

This is a beta scheduler, and should not (at this point) be run in a
production environment, until we better understand how this will
perform, and how it will interact with the currently available filters
and weights.

In the current scheduler, it is very costly making scheduler decisions.
The idea is to make these decisions on our own time, and not on
customers time.

While this does not share code with the filter scheduler, it does use
the same host manager to perform the same filters and weights.

However, the filters and weighs will be run with reduced amounts of
info, so you will need to take care when selecting what filters and
weights are with this scheduler driver.

DocImpact
Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I2eb873ce8024a576e597205e2d52b5d5e8aee97a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-20 15:37:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d1382ae2fb4846903ad272f197bf257f16f8451a', 'message': 'Add a caching scheduler driver

This adds a new experimental scheduler driver, CachingScheduler

This is a beta scheduler, and should not (at this point) be run in a
production environment, until we better understand how this will
perform, and how it will interact with the currently available filters
and weights.

In the current scheduler, it is very costly making scheduler decisions.
The idea is to make these decisions on our own time, and not on
customers time.

While this does not share code with the filter scheduler, it does use
the same host manager to perform the same filters and weights.

However, the filters and weighs will be run with reduced amounts of
info, so you will need to take care when selecting what filters and
weights are with this scheduler driver.

DocImpact
Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I2eb873ce8024a576e597205e2d52b5d5e8aee97a

'}, {'number': 18, 'created': '2014-02-03 19:12:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/162b61e58ab6f88459529fc53b88ce6e10c41cb6', 'message': 'Add a caching scheduler driver

This adds a new experimental scheduler driver, CachingScheduler

It currently subclasses the filter scheduler and only adds caching of
calls to _get_all_host_states.

It relies on there being a small number of scheduler, ideally one,
calls to consume_from_instance within the filter scheduler to update the
current cached list of hosts, and a low rate of deletes.

DocImpact
Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I2eb873ce8024a576e597205e2d52b5d5e8aee97a

'}, {'number': 29, 'created': '2014-02-24 12:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a20cd1d6a22fe847070ac24696c202f977291c14', 'message': 'Add a caching scheduler driver

This adds a new scheduler driver, CachingScheduler

It currently subclasses the filter scheduler and only adds caching of
calls to host_manager.get_all_host_states.

It relies on there being a small number of schedulers, ideally one,
calls to consume_from_instance within the filter scheduler to update the
current cached list of hosts, and a low rate of deletes.

It introduces the new config value:
scheduler_driver_task_period

The periodic task it controls is used by the caching scheduler to fetch
an updated copy of host_manager.get_all_host_states.

If your value for service_down_time is much smaller than
scheduler_driver_task_period, there will be issues with hosts appearing
to be dead, just because the list of hosts is being cached. Correct
configuration of those two values can avoid this issue.

DocImpact
Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I2eb873ce8024a576e597205e2d52b5d5e8aee97a

commit_message:
Add a caching scheduler driver

This adds a new scheduler driver, CachingScheduler

It currently subclasses the filter scheduler and only adds caching of
calls to host_manager.get_all_host_states.

It relies on there being a small number of schedulers, ideally one,
calls to consume_from_instance within the filter scheduler to update the
current cached list of hosts, and a low rate of deletes.

It introduces the new config value:
scheduler_driver_task_period

The periodic task it controls is used by the caching scheduler to fetch
an updated copy of host_manager.get_all_host_states.

If your value for service_down_time is much smaller than
scheduler_driver_task_period, there will be issues with hosts appearing
to be dead, just because the list of hosts is being cached. Correct
configuration of those two values can avoid this issue.

DocImpact
Part of blueprint caching-scheduler
Change-Id: I2eb873ce8024a576e597205e2d52b5d5e8aee97a

commit_message:
Revert "always use sitepackages"

This reverts commit c81568fa85620746534331cd820b0bb399719149.

After learning what I learned about how sitepackages works, this
wasn't really a sane change. Revert back to old behavior.

Change-Id: I8079a0f4d9e0bc2e51a743d4f23cf98d4840a3ab

commit_message:
Escape credentials for cirros image upload

Special characters could cause cirros image
upload to fail. Shellquote.escape will ensure
the password passed is valid.
Also fixes typo in cirros image upload failure

Change-Id: I3773385d05e91c87ddf56c251203f6a2068b1c16
Closes-Bug: #1285318

commit_message:
Escape credentials for cirros image upload

Special characters could cause cirros image
upload to fail. Shellquote.escape will ensure
the password passed is valid.
Also fixes typo in cirros image upload failure

Change-Id: I3773385d05e91c87ddf56c251203f6a2068b1c16
Closes-Bug: #1285318

subject: Add tool to run cross-project tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 15:18:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslotest/commit/85c8c2070841e570528607eca167614237d24640', 'message': "Set up tox to run cross-project tests

We don't want to have unit tests running in devstack gate, so we will
set up separate jobs for this repository to run the tests of consuming
projects to ensure we do not break their unit tests with changes to
the library.

This patch creates the script to run the tests and starts a list of the
projects to be tested. None use the library, yet, but they will and I
needed something to use as a proof-of-concept for the test script.

A local project list is used, instead of using the one from devstack-gate,
because not all of the devstack-gate projects will need to be tested here
(not all will use this library).

commit_message:
Add tool to run cross-project tests

Provide a script for the devstack-gate hook to run tests to
ensure that changes in this project do not break unit tests
in consuming projects.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76381 for the script
addition in the gate configuration.

Change-Id: I08d8380183c2128c62fa0ca52306950d8076f3c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/08/74408/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py26-cross] commands = {toxinidir}/tools/run_cross_tests.sh {envdir} py26 [testenv:py27-cross] commands = {toxinidir}/tools/run_cross_tests.sh {envdir} py27 [testenv:py33-cross] deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements-py3.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements-py3.txt commands = {toxinidir}/tools/run_cross_tests.sh {envdir} py33

subject: Guard against oversize flavor rxtx_factor float

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-09 17:30:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/10f0598d7ddfaa9f82593aa33b817057b4003fcc', 'message': 'Guard against oversize flavor rxtx_factor float

the Float type to be stored in the db. While the check is not

commit_message:
Guard against oversize flavor rxtx_factor float

We now check that rxtx_factor provided is not greater than
the Float type to be stored in the db. While the check is not
100% accurate due to float approximation it will be very
close to the max allowable. A 400 error is returned if the
provided value is too big.

Closes-Bug: 1259213
Change-Id: I72c52fa46d75275c45e72b6f5a36106d5abf8220
Co-authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/60887/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rxtx_factor_must_be_within_sql_float_range(self): _context = context.get_admin_context() inst_types = db.flavor_get_all(_context) # We do * 10 since this is an approximation and we need to make sure # the difference is noticeble. over_rxtx_factor = flavors.SQL_FLOAT_MAX * 10 self.assertInvalidInput('flavor1', 64, 1, 120, rxtx_factor=over_rxtx_factor) flavor = flavors.create('flavor2', 64, 1, 120, rxtx_factor=flavors.SQL_FLOAT_MAX) self.assertEqual(flavors.SQL_FLOAT_MAX, flavor['rxtx_factor'])

commit_message:
enable -o errexit

devstack should run under -o errexit to ensure that we fail early
when something has gone wrong, otherwise determination of the root
failure location is often quite challenging.

this clears all the normal use cases for devstack, there could be
tests which now die early, which we're going to have to check for
later.

Change-Id: Ibd828c4f4fd95a60d3918d3d7ae90e10649479ab

commit_message:
Added HOT Template for 2 Servers Without Floating IPs

Previously, a HOT template existed for deploying 2 servers using
an existing Neutron network and assigning Floating IPs to provide
public access.  This template does not work well when using
Neutron Provider Networking Extensions where Floating IPs are
unneeded to directly access instances. The template also creates
and associates the 2 servers to a Neutron Security Group that
allows SSH and ICMP.

Change-Id: Id827ce8fe2ea705066ca536bfe86e5a06a3fce2a

on F18.

commit_message:
Included new section to add floating IPs using dashboard

Updated the 'Configure access and security for instances' section in the
dashboard chapter of the End User Guide to include a new section 'Allocating
floating IP addresses to instances'.
Closes-Bug: #1280926

Change-Id: Id273e9bca078006679dc9b0273634d1220c02ac9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/96/76096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="add_floating_ip"> <title>Allocating floating IP addresses to instances</title> <para> When an instance is created in OpenStack, it is automatically assigned a fixed IP address in the network to which the instance is assigned. This IP address is permanently associated with the instance until the instance is terminated.</para> <para>However, a floating IP address can also be attached to an instance (in addition to their fixed IP address). Unlike fixed IP addresses, floating IP addresses are able to have their associations modified at any time, regardless of the state of the instances involved. This procedure details the reservation of a floating IP address from an existing pool of addresses and the association of that address with a specific instance.</para> <procedure> <step> <para>Log in to the dashboard, choose a project, and click the <guilabel>Access & Security</guilabel> category.</para> </step> <step> <para>The <guilabel>Access & Security</guilabel> opens to the <guilabel>Security Groups</guilabel> tab by default.</para> <para>Click on the <guilabel>Floating IPs</guilabel> tab. The <guilabel>Floating IPs</guilabel> tab shows the floating IP addresses allocated to instances.</para> </step> <step><para>Click the <guibutton>Allocate IP to Project</guibutton> button.</para> </step> <step> <para>Choose the <guilabel>Pool</guilabel> from which the IP address should be picked.</para> </step> <step> <para>Click the <guibutton>Allocate IP</guibutton> button.</para> </step> <step> <para>In the <guilabel>Floating IPs</guilabel> list, click the <guibutton> Associate</guibutton> button. The <guilabel>Manage Floating IP Associations</guilabel> window opens.</para> </step> <step> <para>In the <guilabel>Manage Floating IP Associations</guilabel> window, choose the following options: <orderedlist> <listitem> <para>The <guilabel>IP Address</guilabel> field is filled automatically.</para> <para>You can choose to add a new IP address by using the <guibutton>+</guibutton> button.</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>In the <guilabel>Ports to be associated</guilabel> field, select a port from the dropdown list.</para> <para>The dropdown lists all the instances with their respective fixed IP addresses.</para> </listitem> </orderedlist> </para> </step> <step> <para>Click the <guibutton>Associate</guibutton> button.</para> </step> <!--<step> <para> </para> </step>--> </procedure> <para>You have successfully associated a floating IP address with your instance.</para> <note> <para>To disassociate the IP address from an instance, click the <guibutton>Disassociate</guibutton> button.</para> <para>To release the floating IP address back into the pool of addresses, click the <guibutton>More</guibutton> dropdown button and select <guilabel>Release Floating IP</guilabel> option.</para> </note> </section>

subject: [hadoop-swift] Added auth check before getData call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 01:02:57.000000000', 'files': ['hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/http/SwiftRestClient.java'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-extra/commit/fab9840abf46f3867eba81ee95b3b3cbda2124ac', 'message': "[hadoop-swift] Added auth check before getData call

Without such check client doesn't try to authenticate during method call.
This leads to read failure in case if this is the first use of client.

Change-Id: Ib2389a83b4e73fac49066ffe0411ff430482f848
Closes-Bug: #1284906
"}]
commit_message:
[hadoop-swift] Added auth check before getData call

Without such check client doesn't try to authenticate during method call.
This leads to read failure in case if this is the first use of client.

Change-Id: Ib2389a83b4e73fac49066ffe0411ff430482f848
Closes-Bug: #1284906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-extra refs/changes/05/76405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: preRemoteCommand("getData"); preRemoteCommand("getData"); preRemoteCommand("getData");

added_lines: from oslo.config import cfg from wsme.rest import json as wjsoncfg.CONF.import_opt('host', 'solum.api.app', group='api') cfg.CONF.import_opt('port', 'solum.api.app', group='api') @classmethod def from_db_object(cls, obj): host, port = cfg.CONF.api.host, cfg.CONF.api.port server_url = 'http://%s:%d/v1' % (host, port) json_extension = {'type': 'extension', 'uri': '%s/extensions/%s' % (server_url, obj.id), 'user_id': obj.user_id, 'project_id': obj.project_id, 'name': obj.name, 'version': obj.version, 'documentation': obj.documentation} return cls(**json_extension) def as_dict(self): return wjson.tojson(Extension, self)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 16:35:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/3c1bda183f1b19dcb16e9a24e7c42dd1bc4f3d0f', 'message': "Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly

The SIZE_RE regex was not accounting for the fact that the size of the
file can be reported as a float style number (eg '2.0G') and so the size
of the file was not being reported in bytes correctly.

Change-Id: Id584b7d6710245cf7787f557d1ec87b569d943f7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-27 16:37:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/imageutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/e3b8c01d3000fdbc934c43abfe8301bea4309a28', 'message': "Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly

The SIZE_RE regex was not accounting for the fact that the size of the
file can be reported as a float style number (eg '2.0G') and so the size

Change-Id: Id584b7d6710245cf7787f557d1ec87b569d943f7
Closes-Bug: #1285764
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regex for file size to parse float-style numbers properly

The SIZE_RE regex was not accounting for the fact that the size of the
file can be reported as a float style number (eg '2.0G') and so the size
of the file was not being reported in bytes correctly.

Change-Id: Id584b7d6710245cf7787f557d1ec87b569d943f7
Closes-Bug: #1285764
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/10/76910/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SIZE_RE = re.compile(r"([\d\.]+)(\w+)?(\s*\(\s*(\d+)\s+bytes\s*\))?", re.I)

::Chef::EncryptedDataBagItem.stub(:load).with('db_passwords', 'nova', 'secret').and_return value @subject.stub(:node).and_return @chef_run.node result = @subject.get_password('db', 'nova') result.should == 'this' end end describe '#get_password_user_password' do it 'returns index param when developer_mode is true' do @chef_run = ::ChefSpec::Runner.new(::CHEFSPEC_OPTS) do |n| n.set['openstack']['developer_mode'] = true @chef_run.converge 'openstack-common::default' @subject.stub(:node).and_return @chef_run.node result = @subject.get_password('user', 'nova') result.should == 'nova' it 'returns databag when developer_mode is false' do value = { 'nova' => 'this' } ::Chef::EncryptedDataBagItem.stub(:load_secret).with('/etc/chef/openstack_data_bag_secret').and_return 'secret' ::Chef::EncryptedDataBagItem.stub(:load).with('user_passwords', 'nova', 'secret').and_return value @subject.stub(:node).and_return @chef_run.node result = @subject.get_password('user', 'nova') result.should == 'this'

commit_message:
Make TRADITIONAL the default SQL mode

Rather than log a warning when TRADITIONAL mode is not enabled,
just make it the default. If this causes INSERTs or UPDATEs from
applications to break, it just exposes that they are inserting
broken data to begin with.

Change-Id: I84c1781454ed5f46c7a135c96bafc575f313f9bc

commit_message:
Cleanup Endpoint V3 documentation

This change removes 'name' from the request attributes for endpoints.
This also details more specific request and response examples when
working with V3 endpoints. Added documentation for GET on a single
endpoint.

Change-Id: Ie1851c4e0fa3575be040f0858709d553414f37b2

commit_message:
Remove termios support (and associated issues)

This is to fix issues related to devstack, marconi-server was
crashing with no screen mode.

Change-Id: Ida12606f44d1c5b2bd981834858302f03df8ed96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/68/76668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import termiosdef _enable_echo(enable): """Enables or disables terminal echo. :param enable: pass True to enable echo, False to disable """ if not os.isatty(sys.stdin.fileno()): # if we are not running in an interactive shell we will get # termios.error: (25, 'Inappropriate ioctl for device') return fd = sys.stdin.fileno() new_attr = termios.tcgetattr(fd) if enable: new_attr[3] |= termios.ECHO else: new_attr[3] &= ~termios.ECHO termios.tcsetattr(fd, termios.TCSANOW, new_attr) atexit.register(_enable_echo, True) _enable_echo(False)

commit_message:
Fix test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test

This patch increases the scenario timeout form 0.001 to 1. This ensures
that there is time for the exceptions to be thrown as expected.

Change-Id: I1007436736bf9d42b98c8782a6141203c271aa75
Closes-bug: #1283372

commit_message:
neutron-metering-agent service name is wrong

In Ubuntu the neutron-metering-agent package and Upstart service are named
neutron-plugin-metering-agent. In Debian they are named
neutron-metering-agent.

Partial-Bug: #1284179
(cherry picked from commit 57e16648629b8c541e094b848cecac53137949c4)

Change-Id: I76b56886a4d239b279731dc1e85c17a7f380aa76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/61/76661/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :metering_agent_service => 'neutron-plugin-metering-agent' }

commit_message:
Remove oslo.uuidutils

The only use of uuidutils in barbican is generate_uuid
which will be dropped from oslo-incubator.

This patch moves generate_uuid to barbican.common.utils and
updates the context module from oslo.

Following changes were updated in context:

13eb01c Adding domain to context and log
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
bdabd51 Remove uuidutils imports in oslo modules
44e8222 Revert "Removes generate_uuid from uuidutils"
571a78a Removes generate_uuid from uuidutils
36859e5 Adding instance_uuid to context and log

Change-Id: If27f8308f00ce92d8cde0bc1c669c8020137eba5
Partial-bug: #1253497

""" import uuid def generate_uuid(): return str(uuid.uuid4()) def is_uuid_like(val): """Returns validation of a value as a UUID. For our purposes, a UUID is a canonical form string: aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa """ try: return str(uuid.UUID(val)) == val except (TypeError, ValueError, AttributeError): return False

commit_message:
Implemented version printing in fuelclient

 * fuelclient version is printed
 * turned handle_xception in to decorator
 * nailgun version and build_id also can be
 printed with --fuel-version

 Implements: blueprint fuel-and-fuelclient-version-printing

Change-Id: I5593f78dce97bf710ab9c6af6fad1e4211f78c4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/25/76225/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FUELCLIENT_VERSION = "0.1"def get_version(): version_path = "/etc/nailgun/version.yaml" version_data = { "client_version": FUELCLIENT_VERSION } if os.path.exists(version_path): with open(version_path, "r") as fh: version_from_file = yaml.load(fh) version_data.update(version_from_file["VERSION"]) else: version_data.update(json_api_get_request("version")) return ("client-version: {client_version}. Fuel server release: " "{release} (buld_id: {build_id})").format(**version_data) version=get_version()

commit_message:
Enable flake8 H404 checking

This check indicates on comments in which multi line docstring should
start without a leading new line. This change fixed all violators of
said check.

Change-Id: Ic7357b8c7420767dba611f6fcee07b7700f3aea8

commit_message:
Skip test_get_instance_action test for nova v3

InstanceActionsV3Test.test_get_instance_action() relies on the
x-compute-request-id header existing in the response from create_test_server()
in setUpClass(). That header name is going to be replaced for nova v3,
pending change I5e370fd3de5ee2f8a8d13553015d88910ff5ea87

So for now, skip that test in v3. The header name can be updated after the nova
change merges.

Change-Id: Ia1880dd53b7cbf34e66b349f01afb15672dffd12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/44/73044/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: cls.request_id = resp['x-compute-request-id'] except KeyError: msg = 'Skipped since x-compute-request-id header is going away' raise exceptions.TestCase.skipException(msg)

commit_message:
Don't store engine instances in oslo.db (WIP)

This patch is a quick-and-dirty proof of concept for remove engine
instances from oslo.db code. See patch in oslo-incubator -
I330467ec1317e1a13ff9f0237e2d8900d718e379

We don't want to store any engine instances globally in oslo.db and
suppose, that it's up to end applications to decide how to cope with
engines.

Change-Id: Icf4e33c963080c4b3b2f9e264f415348f77fadad

commit_message:
VPNaaS service name is wrong

In Ubuntu the VPNaaS service name and package are
neutron-plugin-vpn-agent. In Debian the VPNaaS service name and package
are neutron-vpn-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1285314
(cherry picked from commit 1e3ff014972fb0f18f8509d404df583ec8a11762)

Change-Id: Id3a0e2e939d2608802b3b2b39634e6c8bb3c32f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/62/76662/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $vpnaas_agent_service = 'neutron-plugin-vpn-agent'

commit_message:
Remove compute_scheduler_driver option

The {compute,volume}_scheduler_driver options exist in Grizzly
release, we should remove it from havana and current config reference.

Change-Id: Ie5e5f3ed272714ef792dbfe9f4c9303031d8d62e
Closes-Bug: #1285202
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/41/76741/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: determine how to dispatch compute requests. For example, the <systemitem <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.FilterSchedulerscheduler_default_filters=RetryFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter</programlisting> <para>By default, the scheduler_driver is configured as a filter <para>Have not been attempted for scheduling purposes (<literal>RetryFilter</literal>).</para> </listitem> <listitem> <listitem> <para>Satisfy the extra specs associated with the instance type (<literal>ComputeCapabilitiesFilter</literal>).</para> </listitem> <listitem> <para>Satisfy any architecture, hypervisor type, or virtual machine mode properties specified on the instance's image properties. (<literal>ImagePropertiesFilter</literal>).</para> </listitem> created.</para> <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_default_filters=RetryFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter</programlisting> which randomly selects from lists of filtered hosts.</para>
deleted_lines: determine how to dispatch compute and volume requests. For example, the <systemitem <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.multi.MultiScheduler compute_scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.FilterSchedulerscheduler_default_filters=AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter least_cost_functions=nova.scheduler.least_cost.compute_fill_first_cost_fn compute_fill_first_cost_fn_weight=-1.0</programlisting> <para>By default, the compute scheduler is configured as a filter <para>For information on the volume scheduler, refer the Block Storage section of <link xlink:href="http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/managing-volumes.html"> <citetitle>OpenStack Cloud Administrator Guide</citetitle></link> for information.</para> created. You can use this scheduler to schedule compute requests but not volume requests. For example, you can use it with only the <literal>compute_scheduler_driver</literal> configuration option.</para> <programlisting language="ini">scheduler_default_filters=AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,ComputeFilter</programlisting> which randomly selects from lists of filtered hosts. It is the default volume scheduler.</para>

commit_message:
Update pre_live_migration to take instance object

Update the pre_live_migration method in the compute api, compute manager,
and virt driver to take an instance object.  The update to the compute manager
call also happens to finish the conversion of
ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance in the virt driver API, as well.

Part of blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: I2ddb1d72dbbd11e153f75171b3a4dc4f87ca3972

commit_message:
Install lvm2 package for cinder

Adds lvm2 package to get installed for the cinder package install. lvm2
is needed by the 72-cinder-resize-volume-groups os-refresh-config script
since that script uses the "vgs" command.

Change-Id: Ie18a9bf3e82983888cad33aef9dc0ab56afe1374
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/56/73656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # lvm2 is required by our cinder script in migration.d, but not by the cinder # package itself. install-packages openstack-cinder lvm2

Avoid races with Neutron by waiting for it.

We're seeing this both locally and in CI, probably load related.

commit_message:
Mildly wound the interlopers

This commit removes all the references to nose in the tempest tree.
Moving forward trying to support nose which doesn't support some of the
features we rely on in tempest is increasingly difficult. Please refer
to this thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/024673.html

for a more detailed explanation and the discussion regarding this.

Change-Id: I3dee566d33efe1fb7808817b885d1680736abe6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/72040/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sysmodule_list = sys.modules() for module in module_list: if 'nose' in module: raise exceptions.RunWithNose() """A decorator which applies the testtools attr decorator This decorator applies the testtools.testcase.attr if it is in the list of attributes to testtools we want to apply. return f
deleted_lines: import nose.plugins.attrib """A decorator which applies the nose and testtools attr decorator This decorator applies the nose attr decorator as well as the the testtools.testcase.attr if it is in the list of attributes to testtools we want to apply. return nose.plugins.attrib.attr(*args, **kwargs)(f)# there is a mis-match between nose and testtools for older pythons. # testtools will set skipException to be either # unittest.case.SkipTest, unittest2.case.SkipTest or an internal skip # exception, depending on what it can find. Python <2.7 doesn't have # unittest.case.SkipTest; so if unittest2 is not installed it falls # back to the internal class. # # The current nose skip plugin will decide to raise either # unittest.case.SkipTest or its own internal exception; it does not # look for unittest2 or the internal unittest exception. Thus we must # monkey-patch testtools.TestCase.skipException to be the exception # the nose skip plugin expects. # # However, with the switch to testr nose may not be available, so we # require you to opt-in to this fix with an environment variable. # # This is temporary until upstream nose starts looking for unittest2 # as testtools does; we can then remove this and ensure unittest2 is # available for older pythons; then nose and testtools will agree # unittest2.case.SkipTest is the one-true skip test exception. # # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33056 # https://github.com/nose-devs/nose/pull/699 if 'TEMPEST_PY26_NOSE_COMPAT' in os.environ: try: import unittest.case.SkipTest # convince pep8 we're using the import... if unittest.case.SkipTest: pass raise RuntimeError("You have unittest.case.SkipTest; " "no need to override") except ImportError: LOG.info("Overriding skipException to nose SkipTest") testtools.TestCase.skipException = nose.plugins.skip.SkipTest

commit_message:
Remove unused method inject_file()

Remove the unused method, inject_file(), from the compute.api and
compute.rpcapi.  mark it deprecated on the manager side to be removed on the
next major iteration of the compute rpc interface.

Related to blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: I53339e39604f90cf7ecf159da78c4e8e9283bf87

commit_message:
Removed copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.
Please note, Oslo (nova/openstack/common) not changed!

Closes-bug: #1262424
