git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/24/74124/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ``pip install -e`` the package, which processes the dependencies # using pip before running `setup.py develop` # # Updates the dependencies in project_dir from the # openstack/requirements global list before installing anything. # # Uses globals ``TRACK_DEPENDS``, ``REQUIREMENTS_DIR`` # setup_develop directory function setup_develop() { local project_dir=$1 echo "cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR; $SUDO_CMD python update.py $project_dir" # Don't update repo if local changes exist # Don't use buggy "git diff --quiet" (cd $project_dir && git diff --exit-code >/dev/null) local update_requirements=$? if [ $update_requirements -eq 0 ]; then (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR; \ $SUDO_CMD python update.py $project_dir) fi setup_develop_no_requirements_update $project_dir # We've just gone and possibly modified the user's source tree in an # automated way, which is considered bad form if it's a development # tree because we've screwed up their next git checkin. So undo it. # # However... there are some circumstances, like running in the gate # where we really really want the overridden version to stick. So provide # a variable that tells us whether or not we should UNDO the requirements # changes (this will be set to False in the OpenStack ci gate) if [ $UNDO_REQUIREMENTS = "True" ]; then if [ $update_requirements -eq 0 ]; then (cd $project_dir && git reset --hard) fi fi } # ``pip install -e`` the package, which processes the dependencies # using pip before running `setup.py develop` # Uses globals ``STACK_USER`` # setup_develop_no_requirements_update directory function setup_develop_no_requirements_update() { local project_dir=$1 pip_install -e $project_dir # ensure that further actions can do things like setup.py sdist safe_chown -R $STACK_USER $1/*.egg-info }

subject: Fixes a race condition in resize flavor for Percona
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 06:12:46.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/api/instances_resize.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/c88c88fa3ddc2f171b6fec5cce3c09e268294b02', 'message': 'Fixes a race condition in resize flavor for Percona

When a resize happens immediately after an instances gets created,
the mysql process doesnt have enough time to finished up
provisioning before the resize-action invokes a stop and start
resizing. Although the trove tries to stop mysql, the stop command
doesnt ensure that mysql was stopped successfully. This causes
mysql to be corrupted when migrated to a different VM. Normally
this is not an issue since mysql provisioning has plenty of time
to finish. This becomes an issue when doing an resize when mysql
has just finished provisioned. Only happens in automated tests.
This fix will ensure that the mysql server is stopped before a
resize is performed.

Change-Id: I0a3c351b61b82b88dfe05325a38ce93d6973a9f6
Closes-Bug: 1284989
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a race condition in resize flavor for Percona

When a resize happens immediately after an instances gets created,
the mysql process doesnt have enough time to finished up
provisioning before the resize-action invokes a stop and start
resizing. Although the trove tries to stop mysql, the stop command
doesnt ensure that mysql was stopped successfully. This causes
mysql to be corrupted when migrated to a different VM. Normally
this is not an issue since mysql provisioning has plenty of time
to finish. This becomes an issue when doing an resize when mysql
has just finished provisioned. Only happens in automated tests.
This fix will ensure that the mysql server is stopped before a
resize is performed.

Change-Id: I0a3c351b61b82b88dfe05325a38ce93d6973a9f6
Closes-Bug: 1284989

commit_message:
Update License Headers to replace Nicira with VMware

In the process __init__.py involved have been emptied;
vim modelines and author lines have been dropped from
the license headers affected by the change as well.

Partial-implements blueprint nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: I9c535b59bb2e83f275816472e0e32b41444d3bbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/40/74440/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Renaming plugin-specific exceptions to match NSX

Try to get rid of Nvp as much as possible, the base
class already uses the plugin short name so it's
pointless to carry it over.

Partial-implements blueprint nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: Ic3e53bc4e41ffe1a19ea03e807ec89bb6c864f51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/18/73518/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.plugins.nicira.common import exceptions as nsx_exc raise nsx_exc.InvalidAttachmentType( raise nsx_exc.NatRuleMismatch(actual_rules=len(to_delete_ids), min_rules=min_num_expected, max_rules=max_num_expected) raise nsx_exc.NsxPluginException(err_msg=msg) raise nsx_exc.NsxPluginException(err_msg=msg) raise nsx_exc.InvalidVersion(version=v) raise nsx_exc.InvalidVersion(version=v)
deleted_lines: from neutron.plugins.nicira.common import exceptions as nvp_exc raise nvp_exc.NvpInvalidAttachmentType( raise nvp_exc.NvpNatRuleMismatch(actual_rules=len(to_delete_ids), min_rules=min_num_expected, max_rules=max_num_expected) raise nvp_exc.NvpPluginException(err_msg=msg) raise nvp_exc.NvpPluginException(err_msg=msg) raise nvp_exc.NvpInvalidVersion(version=v) raise nvp_exc.NvpInvalidVersion(version=v)

commit_message:
Reduced database overhead from agents

 - added dedicated handler for agents requests
 - caching data from agents to avoid db update with same data
 - nailgun responses with appropriate http statuses

Implements: blueprint nailgun-agent-handler
Closes-Bug: #1274614

Change-Id: I73d6e62f3b08f2a287c9c1dbd6a55e88f07cad45

revisions:

set_loaded() method should not be available in class public API cause its
usage can break internal class logic. Base Resource class(method __getattr__)
can behave incorrectly if access to attribute _loaded is provided to end users.

blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I491f9b54c7074546cf738c6150666bfcc3966a78
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-30 15:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'tests/unit/apiclient/test_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/0c4d2c76a6876dd8873cca2736ca5a7f3da66c69', 'message': "Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class

set_loaded() method should not be available in class public API cause its
usage can break internal class logic. Base Resource class(method __getattr__)
can behave incorrectly if access to attribute _loaded is provided to end users.

method get() of Resource class also should be private, because it's
related to internal class logic and doesn't have any meaning from
outside of the class

blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I491f9b54c7074546cf738c6150666bfcc3966a78
"}]
commit_message:
Removed set_loaded() method from Resource class

set_loaded() method should not be available in class public API cause its
usage can break internal class logic. Base Resource class(method __getattr__)
can behave incorrectly if access to attribute _loaded is provided to end users.

method get() of Resource class also should be private, because it's
related to internal class logic and doesn't have any meaning from
outside of the class

blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I491f9b54c7074546cf738c6150666bfcc3966a78

commit_message:
Remove exercises and run tempest smoke tests instead

Smoke and Scenarios tests can offer a better coverage and also it's good to
centralize all tests in tempest.

Change-Id: Iacb60ab011d2c7d90885b339b3c8454bd3de8219
Partial-bug: #1023131
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/09/71009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Exercises --------- The scripts in the exercises directory are meant to 1) perform additional operational checks on certain aspects of OpenStack; and b) set up some instances and data that can be used to verify the upgrade process is non-destructive for the end-user. * Begin and end with a banner that stands out in a sea of script logs to aid in debugging failures, particularly in automated testing situations. If the end banner is not displayed, the script ended prematurely and can be assumed to have failed. :: echo "**************************************************" echo "Begin Grenade Exercise: $0" echo "**************************************************" ... set +o xtrace echo "**************************************************" echo "End Grenade Exercise: $0" echo "**************************************************" * The scripts will generally have the shell ``xtrace`` attribute set to display the actual commands being executed, and the ``errexit`` attribute set to exit the script on non-zero exit codes:: # This script exits on an error so that errors don't compound and you see # only the first error that occurred. set -o errexit # Print the commands being run so that we can see the command that triggers # an error. It is also useful for following allowing as the install occurs. set -o xtrace * Settings and configuration are stored in ``exerciserc``, which must be sourced after ``grenaderc``:: # Import exercise configuration source $TOP_DIR/exerciserc * There are a couple of helper functions in the common ``functions`` sub-script that will check for non-zero exit codes and unset environment variables and print a message and exit the script. These should be called after most client commands that are not otherwise checked to short-circuit long timeouts (instance boot failure, for example):: swift post $CONTAINER if [[ $? != 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "Failure creating container $CONTAINER" fi FLOATING_IP=`euca-allocate-address | cut -f2` die_if_not_set $LINENO FLOATING_IP "Failure allocating floating IP" * If you want an exercise to be skipped when for example a service wasn't enabled for the exercise to be run, you can exit your exercise with the special exitcode 55 and it will be detected as skipped. * The exercise scripts should only use the various OpenStack client binaries to interact with OpenStack. This specifically excludes any ``*-manage`` tools as those assume direct access to configuration and databases, as well as direct database access from the exercise itself. * The exercise MUST clean up after itself even if it is not successful. This is different from current DevStack practice. The exercise SHOULD also clean up or graciously handle possible artifacts left over from previous runs if executed again.

commit_message:
Modifying tests to use the compat client

Modifies tests so they use the old style client code.
This is still exercising the actual v1.* code, it is
just accessing it via the compat module.

Cherry picking the commit to stable/havana

Change-Id: If6f105ec7e94be910784f601112c8368b65d6ec4

commit_message:
'name' should as be optional param on aggregate-update

'name' should be an optional parameter not required on aggregate-update,
so we can update 'availability_zone' only.

Change-Id: I23e669a3362e0bea44adc88744eed823ec1e7ebb
Closes-Bug: #1280118

deleted_lines: @utils.arg('name', metavar='<name>', help='Name of aggregate.') updates = {"name": args.name}

commit_message:
Remove extraneous vim configuration comments

Remove vim setting, Remove line containing:
comment - # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4

at the top of source code files, except for files in
openstack/common.

Change-Id: I5e2aad6dca8407890fc3c2afbda541bd4f124ea8
Closes-Bug: #1229324

Added several test to fuelclient

 * Test for file creation in different actions
 * Added tests for examples in help message epilogs

added_lines: def test_for_examples_in_action_help(self): actions = ( "node", "stop", "deployment", "reset", "task", "network", "settings", "provisioning", "environment", "deploy-changes", "role", "release", "snapshot", "health" ) for action in actions: self.check_all_in_msg("{0} -h".format(action), ("Examples",)) def test_file_creation(self): self.load_data_to_nailgun_server() self.run_cli_commands(( "env create --name=NewEnv --release=1", "--env-id=1 node set --node 1 --role=controller", "--env-id=1 node set --node 2,3 --role=compute" )) for action in ("network", "settings"): self.check_if_file_created( "--env 1 {0} --download".format(action), "{0}_1.yaml".format(action) ) deployment_provision_files = { "--env 1 deployment --default": ( "deployment_1", "deployment_1/controller_1.yaml", "deployment_1/compute_2.yaml", "deployment_1/compute_3.yaml" ), "--env 1 provisioning --default": ( "provisioning_1", "provisioning_1/engine.yaml", "provisioning_1/node-1.yaml", "provisioning_1/node-2.yaml", "provisioning_1/node-3.yaml" ) } for command, files in deployment_provision_files.iteritems(): self.check_if_files_created(command, files) node_configs = ( ( "node --node 1 --disk --default", ("node_1", "node_1/disks.yaml") ), ( "node --node 1 --network --default", ("node_1", "node_1/interfaces.yaml") ) ) for command, files in node_configs: self.check_if_files_created(command, files)

commit_message:
Starts trove-guest if /etc/trove exists

Reasons:
- When provisioning a guest using heat code-path, the guest agent shows
  errors in first-boot.d.log, which is because first-boot tries to start
  trove-guest service before /etc/guest_info file is created by heat
  provisioning.

Changes:
- Adds condition to start trove-guest, to check existence of
  /etc/guest_info, if file exists, then start trove-guest.

Change-Id: I112822fa69b2d4a49d29457fa4b1acf06206c52e
Closes-Bug: #1278733
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/77/72577/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f /etc/guest_info ] ; then service trove-guest start fi

commit_message:
Remove unused admin_context from conductor manager

This variable was used nowhere, plus it referenced three config
variables which were also in the sample config file that Conductor
doesn't need.

Change-Id: I08ffe578158c73d387112b6c05b7ab2c6cae833b

commit_message:
Remove unecessary sys.path add from docs/config.py

We explore, that sys.path magic in docs/conf.py is unecessary now. Also,
removing this strings provides compatibility with future Sphinx
releases.

Change-Id: I7028297f89b2ec0a1ab7007ad2594eec2c9000c0
closes-bug: #1285036

commit_message:
Add test framework for climateclient

Add oslo modules which we will need for tests implementation. Also
add base class for tests, tox instruction for coverage and changes
to dot files.

Change-Id: Ia105f1e5e088ee91ce4b30149d4721df81d28368

commit_message:
update deallocate_for_instance to take instance obj

Update the deallocate_for_instance() method of the nova.network rpc API
to take a full instance object instead of just an instance UUID and some
other instance data.  This patch is just the mechanics of getting the
API changed.  The next patch will make use of getting the full instance
object to eliminate a db query in nova-network.

Part of blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I9be88206ecc64a92d2826a9ac43e4d2d384f29ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/67574/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import instance as instance_obj if 'instance' in kwargs: instance_uuid = kwargs['instance'].uuid else: instance_uuid = kwargs['instance_id'] if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(instance_uuid): # NOTE(francois.charlier): in some cases the instance might be # deleted before the IPs are released, so we need to get # deleted instances too read_deleted_context = context.elevated(read_deleted='yes') instance = instance_obj.Instance.get_by_id( read_deleted_context, instance_uuid) instance_uuid = instance.uuid
deleted_lines: instance_uuid = kwargs.get('instance_id') if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(instance_uuid): # NOTE(francois.charlier): in some cases the instance might be # deleted before the IPs are released, so we need to get deleted # instances too instance = self.db.instance_get( context.elevated(read_deleted='yes'), instance_uuid) instance_uuid = instance['uuid']

Adds IDH element to savanna-image-elements

Add hadoop-ihd element that installs necessary packages
for Intel Distribution Hadoop

Change-Id: Iccfe728309e19c4663b61b7ae1c94e44e95213a0

commit_message:
Added more sample output for commands needed for verification.

Added output from user-role-list which helps with verifying that
the correct role is assigned to the correct user for the related
tenant.

Fixed extra spaces on lines 83-85.

Change-Id: I60601d4f32dff302131ae8da0aeecd6b912b2396
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/65/76765/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>keystone user-role-list</userinput> <computeoutput>+----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+ | id | name | user_id | tenant_id | +----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+ | 9fe2ff9ee4384b1894a90878d3e92bab | _member_ | a4c2d43f80a549a19864c89d759bb3fe | e519b772cb43474582fa303da62559e5 | | 5d3b60b66f1f438b80eaae41a77b5951 | admin | a4c2d43f80a549a19864c89d759bb3fe | e519b772cb43474582fa303da62559e5 | +----------------------------------+----------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+</computeroutput></screen> <para>Seeing that the id in the output from the user-list command matches the user_id in the user-role-list command, and that the admin role is listed for that user, for the related tenant, this verifies that your user account has the <literal>admin</literal> role, which matches the role used in the Identity Service <filename>policy.json</filename>
deleted_lines: <para>This verifies that your user account has the <literal>admin</literal> role, which matches the role used in the Identity Service <filename>policy.json</filename>

commit_message:
Add test db api for compute_node_update with fake compute driver

Note : the fix is commented in this first patchset, I want to confirm the failure
at least with Postgresql backend.

Fixes bug #1285035

Change-Id: Iac887ce809d7380bdccea22346720c0644bdc38c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/76496/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.virt import fake fake.set_nodes('foonode') def test_compute_node_update_with_fake_driver_data(self): compute_node_id = self.item['id'] values = fake.FakeDriver(None).get_available_resource('foonode') stats = jsonutils.loads(self.item['stats']) # change some values: stats['num_instances'] = 8 stats['num_tribbles'] = 1 values['stats'] = jsonutils.dumps(stats) item_updated = db.compute_node_update(self.ctxt, compute_node_id, values) self.assertEqual(1, item_updated['vcpus']) new_stats = jsonutils.loads(item_updated['stats']) self.assertEqual(stats, new_stats)

commit_message:
Remove vim header

No need to set tabstop tons of times, this can be set in your vimrc
file instead.

More disucssion:
http://openstack.10931.n7.nabble.com/Remove-vim-modelines-td21780.html

Change-Id: Ie3353b43fd2c0a7e99dc9fb7a7280be8c976e253
Closes-Bug: #1229324

We have mysql traditional mode set everywhere, but not

Change-Id: I2b930e10a7fa263dbd4e1c9c20070eb7884cc724
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent a false warning from solum-db-manage

We have mysql traditional mode set everywhere, but not
in the db manage session. It gives an alarming message
so correctly setup the session with tradition mode on.

Change-Id: I2b930e10a7fa263dbd4e1c9c20070eb7884cc724
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/30/73930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: session.get_session(mysql_traditional_mode=True)

commit_message:
Different Flavors for Tuskar roles

- different Flavors for control, compute and storage nodes
- for devtest use, they default to 'baremetal', so nothing
  changes
- for Tuskar, there is a possibility to have them different for
  every role

commit_message:
Remove trailing comma from sample JSON

The etc/nova/cells.json sample configuration file contains a trailing
comma on some elements. This is a syntax error, this change corrects the
problem.

Change-Id: I7a8200e8b7704e4377ce597d6beba91b42286469
Closes-bug: #1283718

commit_message:
Remove dependency on log.py from openstack/common

Importing oslo.vmware to another OpenStack project gives the
ArgsAlreadyParsedError: arguments already parsed: cannot register CLI
option exception.
This happens because openstack/common/log.py registers CLI options
after the project using oslo.vmware parses its configuration.

This patch addresses this issue by removing any dependency on
log.py, using logging from the standard python library instead.

Change-Id: Id2bddb8a7efc2a53399e2a2278dba4605da083d8
Closes-Bug: #1284837
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/08/76408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
NetApp copy offload implementation for clustered nfs driver

Copy offload is a special RPC implemented in Ontap that
allows NFS clients to ask the server to copy data between
volumes in the same cluster efficiently. The special
binary will be developed by NetApp and distributed to its customers.
It will address two copy cases after efficient image clone failed.
First when image cache file is present in a different share than
the one holding volume. Second when glance is backed by nfs share
which is on the same cluster as nfs driver backend. Instead
of regular http download the copy offload workflow will be used to copy
image to share and volume.

Implements: blueprint copyoffload
Related-Bug: 1277005

Change-Id: Ib95f7b3890b55b6354f2b3b5e4458a99aee30e7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/50/71250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update server_diagnostics to use instance object

Update the server_diagnostics API to get an instance object and then pass it
through the system down to the virt driver.

Converting the get_diagnostics() call in the compute manager also updates one of
the driver.get_info() calls to take an instance object.  Most had already been
converted.  There was one other stray case in the compute manager where it was
still taking an instance primitive, so this patch hits that one too to finish
the conversion of get_info() while we're at it.

Part of blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: I20b324039c20f5b1fde4d55df2d679b7fb094573
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/76007/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance = compute_api.get(context, server_id, want_objects=True)

commit_message:
libvirt: remove explicit /dev/random rng default

libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
path is specified i.e.

  <rng model='virtio'>
    <backend model='random'/>
  </rng>

It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
decisions about the default device to use.

Also, improve the unit tests to catch this issue.

Change-Id: Ia0f922f7de575496972b4dfa9d56aa22205f1758

commit_message:
VMware: fix instance lookup against vSphere

Modifies the logic to search the vsphere vm for a given
instance. The change now makes use of the config.extraConfig
property to search for the instance.

Change-Id: Id11f44b9792f196ad627879d082ad829869efcdf
Closes-Bug: #1257038

added_lines: def _get_object_for_optionvalue(results, value, option="nvp.vm-uuid"): for object in results.objects: if object.propSet: for propSet in object.propSet: if propSet.key == "config.extraConfig": extra_config = propSet.val options = extra_config.OptionValue for optionValue in options: if optionValue.key == option: if optionValue.value == value: return object.obj else: break def get_vm_ref_from_extraconfig(session, instance_uuid): """Get reference to the VM with the uuid specified.""" vms = session._call_method(vim_util, "get_objects", "VirtualMachine", ["config.extraConfig"]) return _get_object_from_results(session, vms, instance_uuid, _get_object_for_optionvalue) def get_vm_ref(session, instance): """ Get reference to the VM through maching UUID with the config.extraConfig['nvp.vm-uuid'] property """ vm_ref = get_vm_ref_from_extraconfig(session, instance['uuid']) LOG.debug(_("vm_ref returned by get_vm_ref_from_extraconfig %s") % vm_ref) if not vm_ref: """Get reference to the VM through uuid or vm name.""" vm_ref = get_vm_ref_from_uuid(session, instance['uuid'])

commit_message:
Port the docker driver to docker-py and remove custom client code

For simplicity and ease of maintenance, remove the custom REST client
code and imports docker-py.

Adds requirement on docker-py.

Change-Id: I643f55de3638b4023c4489376e5569c5a965aa90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/71605/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
LBaaS: apply loadbalancer instance for agent and haproxy driver

Handle lb instance as new root object in lbaas agent and haproxy driver.
Additianally this forms a base for applying l7 rules for haproxy.

NOTE: the change in the agent  RPC API is backward-incompatible
(major RPC version change), LBaaS server-agent communications will be
completely broken until both sides are upgraded. However this is the
second major lbaas agent API change during Icehouse so it should not
bring any additional problems during upgrade from Havana.

partially implements bp lbaas-service-instance

Change-Id: I8c860c51771587f3d62f208306dc18d62697c348
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/72619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.orm import exc RPC_API_VERSION = '2.1' # 3.0 Handle loadbalancer instance as new root object of LBaaS model # - get_ready_devices()/get_logical_device() handling changed; # - pool_deployed/destroyed -> loadbalancer_deployed/destroyed; loadbalancers = self.plugin.list_loadbalancers_on_agent( context, agents[0].id) return [lb['id'] for lb in loadbalancers['loadbalancers'] if lb['status'] in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING and lb['admin_state_up']] def get_logical_device(self, context, loadbalancer_id=None): try: qry = context.session.query(loadbalancer_db.Loadbalancer) qry = qry.filter_by(id=loadbalancer_id) loadbalancer = qry.one() except exc.NoResultFound: # loadbalancer may already be deleted when a request comes from # the agent return None if (loadbalancer.status not in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING or not loadbalancer.admin_state_up): raise q_exc.Invalid(_('Expected active loadbalancer')) retval = {} retval['loadbalancer'] = self.plugin._make_loadbalancer_dict( loadbalancer) retval['loadbalancer']['pools'] = [] for p in loadbalancer.pools: if not (p.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING and p.admin_state_up): continue pool = self.plugin._make_pool_dict(p) pool['members'] = [ self.plugin._make_member_dict(m) for m in p.members if m.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING or m.status == constants.INACTIVE] pool['healthmonitors'] = [ for hm in p.monitors if hm.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING] retval['loadbalancer']['pools'].append(pool) retval['loadbalancer']['vips'] = [] for v in loadbalancer.vips: if not (v.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING and v.admin_state_up): continue vip = self.plugin._make_vip_dict(v) vip['port'] = ( self.plugin._core_plugin._make_port_dict(v.port) ) for fixed_ip in vip['port']['fixed_ips']: fixed_ip['subnet'] = ( self.plugin._core_plugin.get_subnet( context, fixed_ip['subnet_id'] ) ) retval['loadbalancer']['vips'].append(vip) retval['driver'] = ( self.plugin.drivers[ loadbalancer.provider.provider_name].device_driver) return retval def loadbalancer_deployed(self, context, lb_id): # TODO(obondarev): call self.plugin.update_instance_status() here # when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55032 is merged self.plugin.update_status( context, loadbalancer_db.Loadbalancer, lb_id, constants.ACTIVE) 'loadbalancer': loadbalancer_db.Loadbalancer, def loadbalancer_destroyed(self, context, lb_id=None): """Agent confirmation hook that a loadbalancer has been destroyed. # 2.1 added methods: create/update/delete_loadbalancer def create_pool(self, context, pool, host): return self._cast(context, 'create_pool', {'pool': pool}, host) def create_loadbalancer(self, context, loadbalancer, host, driver_name): return self._cast(context, 'create_loadbalancer', {'loadbalancer': loadbalancer, 'driver_name': driver_name}, host, version='2.1') def update_loadbalancer(self, context, old_loadbalancer, loadbalancer, host): return self._cast(context, 'update_loadbalancer', {'old_loadbalancer': old_loadbalancer, 'loadbalancer': loadbalancer}, host, version='2.1') def delete_loadbalancer(self, context, loadbalancer, host): return self._cast(context, 'delete_loadbalancer', {'loadbalancer': loadbalancer}, host, version='2.1') self.agent_rpc.create_loadbalancer( context, loadbalancer, agent['host'], self.device_driver) agent = self.get_agent_for_loadbalancer( context, loadbalancer['id']) self.agent_rpc.update_loadbalancer( context, old_balancer, loadbalancer, agent['host']) # get agent first to know host as binding will be deleted # after loadbalancer is deleted from db agent = self.get_agent_for_loadbalancer( context, loadbalancer['id']) self.agent_rpc.delete_loadbalancer( context, loadbalancer, agent['host']) self.agent_rpc.create_pool(context, pool, agent['host'])
deleted_lines: RPC_API_VERSION = '2.0' pools = self.plugin.list_pools_on_lbaas_agent(context, agents[0].id) pool_ids = [pool['id'] for pool in pools['pools']] qry = context.session.query(loadbalancer_db.Pool.id) qry = qry.filter(loadbalancer_db.Pool.id.in_(pool_ids)) qry = qry.filter( loadbalancer_db.Pool.status.in_(constants.ACTIVE_PENDING)) up = True # makes pep8 and sqlalchemy happy qry = qry.filter(loadbalancer_db.Pool.admin_state_up == up) return [id for id, in qry] def get_logical_device(self, context, pool_id=None): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): qry = context.session.query(loadbalancer_db.Pool) qry = qry.filter_by(id=pool_id) pool = qry.one() if pool.status != constants.ACTIVE: raise q_exc.Invalid(_('Expected active pool')) retval = {} retval['pool'] = self.plugin._make_pool_dict(pool) if pool.vip: retval['vip'] = self.plugin._make_vip_dict(pool.vip) retval['vip']['port'] = ( self.plugin._core_plugin._make_port_dict(pool.vip.port) ) for fixed_ip in retval['vip']['port']['fixed_ips']: fixed_ip['subnet'] = ( self.plugin._core_plugin.get_subnet( context, fixed_ip['subnet_id'] ) ) retval['members'] = [ self.plugin._make_member_dict(m) for m in pool.members if ( m.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING or m.status == constants.INACTIVE) ] retval['healthmonitors'] = [ for hm in pool.monitors if hm.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING ] retval['driver'] = ( self.plugin.drivers[pool.provider.provider_name].device_driver) return retval def pool_deployed(self, context, pool_id): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): qry = context.session.query(loadbalancer_db.Pool) qry = qry.filter_by(id=pool_id) pool = qry.one() # set all resources to active if pool.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING: pool.status = constants.ACTIVE if pool.vip and pool.vip.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING: pool.vip.status = constants.ACTIVE for m in pool.members: if m.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING: m.status = constants.ACTIVE for hm in pool.monitors: if hm.status in constants.ACTIVE_PENDING: hm.status = constants.ACTIVE def pool_destroyed(self, context, pool_id=None): """Agent confirmation hook that a pool has been destroyed. def create_pool(self, context, pool, host, driver_name): return self._cast(context, 'create_pool', {'pool': pool, 'driver_name': driver_name}, host) # TODO(obondarev): send create_loadbalancer message to the agent # once agent supports loadbalancer instance # TODO(obondarev): send update_loadbalancer message to the agent # once agent supports loadbalancer instance pass self.agent_rpc.create_pool(context, pool, agent['host'], self.device_driver)

commit_message:
LBaaS: apply agent scheduling for loadbalancer instance

Since loadbalancer instance becomes the root object in LBaaS model
we need to bind instance to an agent instead of binding the pool

Existing pool related lbaas_agent_scheduler API operations are left
for backward compatibility

DocImpact:
pool related lbaas_agent_scheduler API operations should be marked
as deprecated:
List pools the given LBaaS agent is hosting:
 GET /agents/agent_id/loadbalancer-pools
Show a LBaaS agent hosting the given pool:
 GET /lb/pools/pool_id/loadbalancer-agent
New lbaas_agent_scheduler API operations:
List loadbalancers the given LBaaS agent is hosting:
 GET /agents/agent_id/loadbalancer-instances
Show an LBaaS agent hosting the given loadbalancer:
 GET /lb/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id/loadbalancer-agent

partially implements bp lbaas-service-instance

Change-Id: If76b407510f90253e59d796a318c09163fa45acb

subject: Allow services to be multiple-worker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 20:22:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6c313e137d325810f6aba16a2074dcad2ecb974a', 'message': 'Allow services to be multiple-worker

Add the ability to run every nova service as multiple processes.

This will help scaling where C calls can block the eventlet hub from
switching greenthreads.  (Example: MySQLdb driver)

Processes are referred to as "workers" in the code.

Multiple *_workers config flags have been added to control the
number of workers.  These mimic the style of the existing flags used
by the API services.

DocImpact

Processes are referred to as "workers" in the code.

Multiple *_workers config flags have been added to control the
number of workers.  These mimic the style of the existing flags used
by the API services.

commit_message:
Allow services to be multiple-worker

Add the ability to run every nova service as multiple processes.

This will help scaling where C calls can block the eventlet hub from
switching greenthreads.  (Example: MySQLdb driver)

Processes are referred to as "workers" in the code.

Multiple *_workers config flags have been added to control the
number of workers.  These mimic the style of the existing flags used
by the API services.

The ProcessLauncher code is not Windows compatible (Windows pipes don't
support non-blocking I/O) so default to 1 worker.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If0d7f36e348d9a0b2e62094fcb8fdea612f3a843

commit_message:
Add cold-migration on server test

Add test to cold-migrate an active server and confirm after
verify_resize status.
Add test to cold-migrate an active server and revert after
verify_resize status.

Change-Id: Ib12574a9d065bb3f4736e024dbf5bc2c55f2b253
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/68033/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from tempest.api.compute import base from tempest import config from tempest.test import attr class ColdMigrationTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeAdminTest): _host_key = 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' _interface = 'json' CONF = config.CONF @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(ColdMigrationTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() cls.admin_hosts_client = cls.os_adm.hosts_client cls.admin_servers_client = cls.os_adm.servers_client cls.created_server_ids = [] def _get_compute_hostnames(self): _resp, body = self.admin_hosts_client.list_hosts() return [ host_record['host_name'] for host_record in body if host_record['service'] == 'compute' ] def _get_server_details(self, server_id): _resp, body = self.admin_servers_client.get_server(server_id) return body def _get_host_for_server(self, server_id): return self._get_server_details(server_id)[self._host_key] def _cold_migrate_server_to(self, server_id, dest_host): _resp, body = self.admin_servers_client.migrate_server( server_id) return body def _get_server_status(self, server_id): return self._get_server_details(server_id)['status'] def _get_an_active_server(self): for server_id in self.created_server_ids: if 'ACTIVE' == self._get_server_status(server_id): return server_id else: _, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until="ACTIVE") server_id = server['id'] self.password = server['adminPass'] self.password = 'password' self.created_server_ids.append(server_id) return server_id @attr(type='gate') def test_resize_confirm_cold_migration(self): # Live block migrate an instance to another host if len(self._get_compute_hostnames()) < 2: raise self.skipTest( "Less than 2 compute nodes, skipping migration test.") server_id = self._get_an_active_server() actual_host = self._get_host_for_server(server_id) self._cold_migrate_server_to(server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE') self.servers_client.confirm_resize(server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server_id, 'ACTIVE') self.assertNotEqual(actual_host, self._get_host_for_server(server_id)) @attr(type='gate') def test_resize_revert_cold_migration(self): # Live block migrate an instance to another host if len(self._get_compute_hostnames()) < 2: raise self.skipTest( "Less than 2 compute nodes, skipping migration test.") server_id = self._get_an_active_server() actual_host = self._get_host_for_server(server_id) self._cold_migrate_server_to(server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server_id, 'VERIFY_RESIZE') self.servers_client.revert_resize(server_id) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server_id, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual(actual_host, self._get_host_for_server(server_id)) @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): for server_id in cls.created_server_ids: cls.servers_client.delete_server(server_id) super(ColdMigrationTestJSON, cls).tearDownClass() class ColdMigrationTestXML(ColdMigrationTestJSON): _host_key = ( '{http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/extended_status/api/v1.1}host') _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
VMware: Store vCenter passwords in keystone credential store

Gives the VMware driver the capability to lookup the vcenter user and
password in keystone credential store if they are not in nova.conf.

DocImpact: host_username and host_password no longer required
Change-Id: I0e310bb9caf369f3b79328097e9896236a3f0e6f
Implements: blueprint vmware-encrypt-vcenter-passwords

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (c) 2014 VMware, Inc. # Copyright 2014 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ A utility to lookup vCenter passwords in the keystone credential store. """ from oslo.config import cfg from keystoneclient.v3 import client as keyclient from nova.openstack.common import jsonutils keystone_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('auth_host', default='127.0.0.1', help='Host providing the admin Identity API endpoint'), cfg.IntOpt('auth_port', default=35357, help='Port of the admin Identity API endpoint'), cfg.StrOpt('auth_protocol', default='https', help='Protocol of the admin Identity API endpoint' '(http or https)'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_user', help='Keystone account username'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_password', secret=True, help='Keystone account password'), cfg.StrOpt('admin_tenant_name', default='admin', help='Keystone service account tenant name to validate' ' user tokens')] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(keystone_opts, 'keystone_authtoken') def get_vmware_credential(host_ip): auth_url = '%s://%s:%s/v3' % (CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_protocol, CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_host, CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_port) params = { 'username': CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_user, 'password': CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_password, 'project_name': CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_tenant_name, 'auth_url': auth_url } keystone = keyclient.Client(**params) creds = keystone.credentials.list() for cred in creds: if cred.type == 'vmware': blob = jsonutils.loads(cred.blob) if blob['host_ip'] == host_ip: return (blob['host_username'], blob['host_password'])

api: complex queries order by validation with voluptuous

voluptuous rathern than JSON Schema.

Added unit tests for plugins/nicira/api_client/client_eventlet.py

Change-Id: Iec0ec7d806ce64d412c13b3293d8ffa0ed727761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/60270/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import httplib import mock from neutron.common import exceptions as com_exc from neutron.plugins.nicira.api_client.client_eventlet import \ NvpApiClientEventlet from neutron.plugins.nicira.api_client import request_eventlet from neutron.tests import base class TestNvpApiClient(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestNvpApiClient, self).setUp() self.host = '127.0.0.0' self.port = 7777 self.data = (self.host, self.port, False) self.sec_data = (self.host, self.port, True) self.testNvpApiClient = NvpApiClientEventlet([self.data], 'user', 'password') self.connection = self.testNvpApiClient._create_connection(*self.data) self.s_conn = self.testNvpApiClient._create_connection(*self.sec_data) def tearDown(self): super(TestNvpApiClient, self).tearDown() del self.testNvpApiClient def test_acquire_redirect_connection(self): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.connection, self.data) self.assertEqual(self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._conn_params(self.connection)) result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_redirect_connection( self.data) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) self.assertNotIn(result, self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.queue) self.assertEqual((1, self.data), (result.priority, (result.host, result.port, False))) @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, '_wait_for_login') def test_acquire_redirect_connection_null_data(self, mock_wait_for_login): origin_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() mock_wait_for_login.return_value = True result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_redirect_connection( conn_params=self.sec_data, auto_login=False) new_size = self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.qsize() self.assertEqual(2 * origin_size - 1, new_size) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) self.assertNotIn((result.priority, result), self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.queue) self.assertEqual(self.sec_data, (result.host, result.port, True)) self.assertFalse(mock_wait_for_login.called) @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, 'auth_cookie') @mock.patch.object(NvpApiClientEventlet, '_wait_for_login') def test_acquire_redirect_connection_not_conn_params(self, mock_wait_for_login, mock_auth_cookie): self.testNvpApiClient._set_provider_data(self.s_conn, self.sec_data) mock_auth_cookie.return_value = None mock_wait_for_login.return_value = True result = self.testNvpApiClient.acquire_redirect_connection( self.sec_data) self.assertIsInstance(result, httplib.HTTPConnection) self.assertNotIn(result, self.testNvpApiClient._conn_pool.queue) self.assertEqual((0, self.sec_data), (result.priority, (result.host, result.port, True))) self.assertTrue(mock_auth_cookie.called) self.assertTrue(mock_wait_for_login.called) @mock.patch.object(request_eventlet.NvpApiRequestEventlet, 'join') def test_login(self, mock_join): ret_obj = mock.MagicMock() ret_obj.getheader.return_value = self.data mock_join.return_value = ret_obj self.assertEqual(self.data, self.testNvpApiClient._login(self.s_conn)) @mock.patch.object(request_eventlet.NvpApiRequestEventlet, 'join') def test_login_if_ret_exception(self, mock_join): mock_join.return_value = com_exc.Conflict() self.assertRaises(com_exc.Conflict, self.testNvpApiClient._login) @mock.patch.object(request_eventlet.NvpApiRequestEventlet, 'join') def test_login_null_ret(self, mock_join): mock_join.return_value = None self.assertIsNone(self.testNvpApiClient._login(self.s_conn)) @mock.patch.object(request_eventlet.NvpApiRequestEventlet, 'join') def test_login_null_getheader(self, mock_join): ret_obj = mock.MagicMock() ret_obj.getheader.return_value = None mock_join.return_value = ret_obj self.assertIsNone(self.testNvpApiClient._login(self.s_conn))

subject: Fix race condition in network scheduling to dhcp agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-11 03:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/scheduler/dhcp_agent_scheduler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/030e08c97e8fb7c33737f394ec341ae26871aacb', 'message': 'Fix race condition in network scheduling to dhcp agent

Rarely dhcp agent rpc call get_active_networks_info() can interleave
with network scheduling initiated by create.port.end notification.
In this case scheduling raises and port creation returns 500.
Need to synchronize on DhcpNetworkBindings table.

Closes-Bug: #1276552
Change-Id: I52d94a40772a99c7032dba15b200bf0f21362f93

commit_message:
Fix race condition in network scheduling to dhcp agent

Rarely dhcp agent rpc call get_active_networks_info() can interleave
with network scheduling initiated by create.port.end notification.
In this case scheduling raises and port creation returns 500.
Need to synchronize on DhcpNetworkBindings table.

Closes-Bug: #1276552
Change-Id: I52d94a40772a99c7032dba15b200bf0f21362f93
(cherry picked from commit eed1b7cbdb00a3fbac9f19bab1a2d7366833b753)

commit_message:
Add support for reading from archives

Fix PEP8 errors
Put a limit on the size of uncompressed content
Add configuration parameter to activate the feature

Implements: blueprint read-from-archives
Change-Id: Idc9eaf29fa6c500ae8697bc5984ee298f5f49bc7

""" get_as Extension to Object Server for Swift """ import io import zipfile import uuid from swift.common.swob import Response, HTTPBadRequest, HTTPNotFound, HTTPUnprocessableEntity, HTTPMethodNotAllowed _boundary = str(uuid.uuid4()) def dump_response(resp): parts = ['{}: {}'.format(h, v) for h, v in resp.headers.items()] + ['', resp.body] return '
'.join(parts) def zip_list_content_response(fp): with zipfile.ZipFile(fp) as zip_file: return Response(status=200, content_type='text/plain', body=('
'.join(zip_file.namelist()) + '
').encode('utf-8')) def zip_get_content_response(fp, files, boundary=_boundary): def part_with_attachment(fn): part = Response(headers={ 'Content-Type': 'application/octet-stream', 'Content-Disposition': 'attachment; filename=%s' % fn.encode('utf-8'), }) try: part.body = zip_file.read(fn) except KeyError: raise HTTPNotFound(body='No %s file in the zip
' % fn.encode('utf-8')) return part with zipfile.ZipFile(fp) as zip_file: if len(files) == 1: resp = part_with_attachment(files[0]) else: resp = Response(content_type='multipart/mixed; boundary=%s' % boundary) body = io.BytesIO() for fn in files: part_resp = part_with_attachment(fn) body.write('
--%s
' % boundary) body.write(dump_response(part_resp)) body.write('
--%s--
' % boundary) resp.body = body.getvalue() return resp def get_as(query, fp): if query.get('as') == 'zip': try: if 'list_content' in query: return zip_list_content_response(fp) elif 'get_content' in query: return zip_get_content_response(fp, query['get_content'].split(',')) else: raise HTTPMethodNotAllowed(body='No such operation is defined on zip file
') except zipfile.BadZipfile: raise HTTPUnprocessableEntity(body='Bad zip file
') else: raise HTTPBadRequest(body='Unknown "as" type
')

commit_message:
refactor showcommand and RetrivePoolStats command

add a resource_for_data_query attribe to support
the case where the query function and returned data
are named differently.

Closes-Bug: #1258369

Change-Id: Ibaff8703104c7e1017a2c9b87f72c51af2024305

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Full oslo-incubator sync

Generated with:
'./update.sh --config-file ../cinder/openstack-common.conf --base cinder
--dest-dir ../cinder'

This patch is a test to see how many things break when doing this.

Following modules aren't require changes to cinder codebase, and are
skipped here:
* db
* policy
* strutils: backwards incompatible changes to strutils.to_string
* imageutils: depends on strutils
* lockutils: backwards incompatible change

Change-Id: Icd81b2519531e747d4e2dec88bc556cf371e2175

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc import functools import os import fixtures import six from cinder.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import session from cinder.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import utils from cinder.openstack.common import test class DbFixture(fixtures.Fixture): """Basic database fixture. Allows to run tests on various db backends, such as SQLite, MySQL and PostgreSQL. By default use sqlite backend. To override default backend uri set env variable OS_TEST_DBAPI_CONNECTION with database admin credentials for specific backend. """ def _get_uri(self): return os.getenv('OS_TEST_DBAPI_CONNECTION', 'sqlite://') def __init__(self, test): super(DbFixture, self).__init__() self.test = test def setUp(self): super(DbFixture, self).setUp() self.test.engine = session.create_engine(self._get_uri()) self.test.sessionmaker = session.get_maker(self.test.engine) self.addCleanup(self.test.engine.dispose) class DbTestCase(test.BaseTestCase): """Base class for testing of DB code. Using `DbFixture`. Intended to be the main database test case to use all the tests on a given backend with user defined uri. Backend specific tests should be decorated with `backend_specific` decorator. """ FIXTURE = DbFixture def setUp(self): super(DbTestCase, self).setUp() self.useFixture(self.FIXTURE(self)) ALLOWED_DIALECTS = ['sqlite', 'mysql', 'postgresql'] def backend_specific(*dialects): """Decorator to skip backend specific tests on inappropriate engines. ::dialects: list of dialects names under which the test will be launched. """ def wrap(f): @functools.wraps(f) def ins_wrap(self): if not set(dialects).issubset(ALLOWED_DIALECTS): raise ValueError( "Please use allowed dialects: %s" % ALLOWED_DIALECTS) if self.engine.name not in dialects: msg = ('The test "%s" can be run ' 'only on %s. Current engine is %s.') args = (f.__name__, ' '.join(dialects), self.engine.name) self.skip(msg % args) else: return f(self) return ins_wrap return wrap @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class OpportunisticFixture(DbFixture): """Base fixture to use default CI databases. The databases exist in OpenStack CI infrastructure. But for the correct functioning in local environment the databases must be created manually. """ DRIVER = abc.abstractproperty(lambda: None) DBNAME = PASSWORD = USERNAME = 'openstack_citest' def _get_uri(self): return utils.get_connect_string(backend=self.DRIVER, user=self.USERNAME, passwd=self.PASSWORD, database=self.DBNAME) @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class OpportunisticTestCase(DbTestCase): """Base test case to use default CI databases. The subclasses of the test case are running only when openstack_citest database is available otherwise a tests will be skipped. """ FIXTURE = abc.abstractproperty(lambda: None) def setUp(self): credentials = { 'backend': self.FIXTURE.DRIVER, 'user': self.FIXTURE.USERNAME, 'passwd': self.FIXTURE.PASSWORD, 'database': self.FIXTURE.DBNAME} if self.FIXTURE.DRIVER and not utils.is_backend_avail(**credentials): msg = '%s backend is not available.' % self.FIXTURE.DRIVER return self.skip(msg) super(OpportunisticTestCase, self).setUp() class MySQLOpportunisticFixture(OpportunisticFixture): DRIVER = 'mysql' class PostgreSQLOpportunisticFixture(OpportunisticFixture): DRIVER = 'postgresql' class MySQLOpportunisticTestCase(OpportunisticTestCase): FIXTURE = MySQLOpportunisticFixture class PostgreSQLOpportunisticTestCase(OpportunisticTestCase): FIXTURE = PostgreSQLOpportunisticFixture

subject: incorrectly quota check for injected_file_contents
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 08:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_quota.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3112694220531820d01d0d7f456ba14fb9b98960', 'message': 'incorrectly quota check for injected_file_contents

File content to be injected as part of instance creation is constrained
by the injected_file_content_bytes quota. The file content need to be
encoded in the client and will be decoded in compute/manager.py. So,
the quota check in compute/api.py is performed against the encoded contents.
However the contents and the encoded contents are not equal in length.
So, it will fails when it should pass if the contents is very close to
the quota limit. We should decoded the contents when check quota.

Change-Id: I4b62665c785f294dd05a4c4ddb95aa107334d77a
Closes-Bug: #1225143
'}]
commit_message:
incorrectly quota check for injected_file_contents

File content to be injected as part of instance creation is constrained
by the injected_file_content_bytes quota. The file content need to be
encoded in the client and will be decoded in compute/manager.py. So,
the quota check in compute/api.py is performed against the encoded contents.
However the contents and the encoded contents are not equal in length.
So, it will fails when it should pass if the contents is very close to
the quota limit. We should decoded the contents when check quota.

Change-Id: I4b62665c785f294dd05a4c4ddb95aa107334d77a
Closes-Bug: #1225143

commit_message:
Sync service module

Sync openstack.common.service from oslo-incubator to get commit
0644073eaf9316c41368c124a9d1ad28fdf2b4f0, which simplifies the
worker argument to launch().

Change-Id: I212d2bc61302ef8ec7a28d3e98492f173bdbf6d8

commit_message:
ValueError should use '%' instead of ','

The method _load_service_plugins() in /neutron/neutron/managers.py
throw a ValueError using ',' to connect log and variables.
ValueError do not support using ',' to connect log and variables,
we should use '%' instead.

Change-Id: I3567e1769e7e2bdfc6eb2e82c5cb2ee060c73829
Closes-Bug:#1264210

commit_message:
Implements provider network support in PLUMgrid plugin

Includes the provider network extension in PLUMgrid plugin
PLUMgrid drivers are updated with the new extension data
Unit tests are added

Change-Id: Ia7fc011c04d143bdb7fd8f67768a2076be8c5264
Implements: blueprint provider-network-plumgrid

commit_message:
Prepare for enabling H302 rule (thirdparty)

We can use H302 rule but ignore it now. This commit prepares for
enabling H302 rule. But this commit modifies tempest/thirdparty only
and excludes some violations[1] because if we fix all of them at one
time, it's hard to merge this commit.

[1]
 tempest.test.attr
 tempest.common.rest_client.RestClient
 tempest.common.rest_client.RestClientXML
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.xml_to_json
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Element
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Document
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.Text
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.XMLNS_11
 tempest.services.compute.xml.common.XMLNS_V3
 tempest/clients.py

Change-Id: Ie5620c283bc5f15e1ae3b257be9749f66f3d91d9

Change command line to command-line

Use "command-line" if it's used as an adjective, for example
"command-line tool".

Improve capitalization and tagging.

commit_message:
Implement the QPID recipe in ops-messaging

Add a very simple recipe for installation qpid, even there is no
qpid cookbook. Leave the dependency in metadata.rb first.

Implement bp: qpid-reference-impl

Change-Id: I972e49a9294315b1c378b851dfaf46798e95c570
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-messaging refs/changes/50/76450/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Cookbook Name:: openstack-ops-messaging # Recipe:: qpid-server # # Copyright 2013, IBM, Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # class ::Chef::Recipe include ::Openstack end bind_interface = node["openstack"]["mq"]["bind_interface"] listen_address = address_for node["openstack"]["mq"]["bind_interface"] # Used by OpenStack HA qpid related recipes node.set["openstack"]["mq"]["listen"] = listen_address if node['openstack']['mq']['cluster'] && node['openstack']['mq']['resource_manager'] == "keepalived" include_recipe "openstack-ha::mq-qpid-active" elsif node['openstack']['mq']['cluster'] include_recipe "openstack-ha::qpid-ha-#{node['openstack']['mq']['resource_manager']}-active" else include_recipe "qpid::single" end

commit_message:
Catch HostBinaryNotFound exception when updating a service

When updating a service with a wrong host or binary name,
HostBinaryNotFound exception is raised. However this exception
isn't caught and the ServiceNotFound exception which won't happen
here is caught instead.
This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I64b138bad74c39d087addcd766b890c4076a2ce8
Closes-Bug: #1273139

added_lines: def test_services_enable_with_invalid_host(self): body = {'service': {'host': 'invalid', 'binary': 'nova-compute'}} req = fakes.HTTPRequestV3.blank('/os-services/enable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, req, "enable", body) def test_services_enable_with_invalid_binary(self): body = {'service': {'host': 'host1', 'binary': 'invalid'}} req = fakes.HTTPRequestV3.blank('/os-services/enable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, req, "enable", body) def test_services_disable_with_invalid_host(self): body = {'service': {'host': 'invalid', 'binary': 'nova-compute'}} req = fakes.HTTPRequestV3.blank('/os-services/disable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, req, "disable", body) def test_services_disable_with_invalid_binary(self): body = {'service': {'host': 'host1', 'binary': 'invalid'}} req = fakes.HTTPRequestV3.blank('/os-services/disable') self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, req, "disable", body)

commit_message:
DB Mappings for NSX security groups

This patch introduces DB mappings between neutron security
groups and NSX security profiles, thus not requiring anymore
the Neutron router ID to be equal to the NSX one.

This change is needed for enabling asynchronous operations in
the NSX plugin.

Related to blueprint nvp-async-backend-communication

Change-Id: I3b28d535c93cd2bfc776aabe0d99be18fce4454d

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """nsx_sec_group_mapping Revision ID: 1b2580001654 Revises: 50e86cb2637a Create Date: 2013-12-27 13:02:42.894648 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '1b2580001654' down_revision = '50e86cb2637a' # Change to ['*'] if this migration applies to all plugins migration_for_plugins = [ 'neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronPlugin.NvpPluginV2', 'neutron.plugins.nicira.NeutronServicePlugin.NvpAdvancedPlugin' ] from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from neutron.db import migration def upgrade(active_plugins=None, options=None): if not migration.should_run(active_plugins, migration_for_plugins): return # Create table for security group mappings op.create_table( 'neutron_nsx_security_group_mappings', sa.Column('neutron_id', sa.String(length=36), nullable=False), sa.Column('nsx_id', sa.String(length=36), nullable=True), sa.ForeignKeyConstraint(['neutron_id'], ['securitygroups.id'], ondelete='CASCADE'), sa.PrimaryKeyConstraint('neutron_id')) # Execute statement to add a record in security group mappings for # each record in securitygroups op.execute("INSERT INTO neutron_nsx_security_group_mappings SELECT id,id " "from securitygroups") def downgrade(active_plugins=None, options=None): if not migration.should_run(active_plugins, migration_for_plugins): return op.drop_table('neutron_nsx_security_group_mappings')

commit_message:
Cleanup and add more config help strings

Cleanup and add expanded helpstrings for the auto generated sample
config.

Change-Id: I2106d8efee9934e6a48e5d0184c5a63754816a74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/37/75537/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help='A "shared secret" that can be used to bootstrap ' 'Keystone. This "token" does not represent a user, ' 'and carries no explicit authorization. To disable ' 'in production (highly recommended), remove ' 'AdminTokenAuthMiddleware from your paste ' 'application pipelines (for example, in ' 'keystone-paste.ini).'), help='The IP Address of the network interface to for the ' 'public service to listen on.'), help='The IP Address of the network interface to for the ' 'admin service to listen on.'), help='The port which the OpenStack Compute service ' 'listens on.'), help='The port number which the admin service listens ' 'on.'), help='The port number which the public service listens ' 'on.'), help='The base public endpoint URL for keystone that are ' 'advertised to clients (NOTE: this does NOT affect ' 'how keystone listens for connections)'), help='The base admin endpoint URL for keystone that are ' 'advertised to clients (NOTE: this does NOT affect ' 'how keystone listens for connections)'), help='onready allows you to send a notification when the ' 'process is ready to serve For example, to have it ' 'notify using systemd, one could set shell command: ' '"onready = systemd-notify --ready" or a module ' 'with notify() method: ' '"onready = keystone.common.systemd"'), help='enforced by optional sizelimit middleware ' '(keystone.middleware:RequestBodySizeLimiter)'), help='similar to max_param_size, but provides an ' 'exception for token values'), help='During a SQL upgrade member_role_id will be used ' 'to create a new role that will replace records in ' 'the user_tenant_membership table with explicit ' 'role grants. Only applies if tcp_keepalive is ' 'True. A domain with this ID will be created ' 'for you by keystone-manage db_sync in migration ' '008. The domain referenced by this ID cannot be ' 'deleted on the v3 API, to prevent accidentally ' 'breaking the v2 API. There is nothing special about ' 'this domain, other than the fact that it must ' 'exist to order to maintain support for your v2 ' 'clients.'), help='A subset (or all) of domains can have their own ' 'identity driver, each with their own partial ' 'configuration file in a domain configuration ' 'directory. This feature is disabled by ' 'default; set to True to enable.'), help='Path for Keystone to locate the domain specific' 'identity configuration files if ' 'domain_specific_drivers_enabled is set to true.'), help='Maximum supported length for user passwords; ' 'decrease to improve performance.'), help='Maximum number of entities that will be returned in ' 'an identity collection')], help='delegation and impersonation features can be ' 'optionally disabled'), help='role-assignment inheritance to projects from ' 'owning domain can be optionally enabled')], help='External auth mechanisms that should add bind ' 'information to token e.g. kerberos, x509'), help='Enforcement policy on tokens presented to keystone ' 'with bind information. This has no ' 'effect unless global caching is enabled.'), help='Time to cache the revocation list (in seconds). Add LengthWrapper in put_object to honor content_length param

Closes-Bug:#1284360

Change-Id: Iec63a3fde77bb8195bfe46c764403b367999ff43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/02/76102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: try: contents.len = content_length except AttributeError: pass conn.putrequest(path, headers=headers, data=contents)

subject: swift.1 manpage fix for groff warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 03:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/manpages/swift.1'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/822274b637e61fbfc035a4991dbf77281e6aea51', 'message': 'swift.1 manpage fix for groff warnings

The current manual page contains hyphens where a minus sign
was intended. By default, "-" chars are interpreted as
hyphens (U+2010) by groff, not as minus signs (U+002D).
Since options to programs use minus signs (U+002D), this
means for example in UTF-8 locales that you cannot cut and
paste options, nor search for them easily.

This patch fixes this by escaping hyphens with backslashes,
and also fixes a typo: s/retreived/retrieved/.

Change-Id: If954c91eebe7b39bdac792f1f126998d2e3bcb8e
'}]
commit_message:
swift.1 manpage fix for groff warnings

The current manual page contains hyphens where a minus sign
was intended. By default, "-" chars are interpreted as
hyphens (U+2010) by groff, not as minus signs (U+002D).
Since options to programs use minus signs (U+002D), this
means for example in UTF-8 locales that you cannot cut and
paste options, nor search for them easily.

This patch fixes this by escaping hyphens with backslashes,
and also fixes a typo: s/retreived/retrieved/.

Change-Id: If954c91eebe7b39bdac792f1f126998d2e3bcb8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/49/74249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The \-p or \-\-prefix is an option that will only list items beginning with that prefix. The \-d or \-\-delimiter is option (for container listings only)The \-l and \-\-lh options provide more detail, similar to ls \-l and ls \-lh, the latterremaining args. The \-c or \-\-changed is an option that will only upload files that have changed since the last upload. The \-\-object-name <object\-name> isand use <object\-name> as object prefix. The \-S <size> or \-\-segment\-size <size> and \-\-leave\-segments are options as well (see \-\-help for more).also allow the \-r (or \-\-read\-acl) and \-w (or \-\-write\-acl) options. The \-m or \-\-meta option is allowed on all and used to define the user meta data\fBExample\fR: post \-m Color:Blue \-m Size:LargeDownloads everything in the account (with \-\-all), or everything in aobject download, you may use the \-o [\-\-output] <filename> option to\-H [\-\-header].Deletes everything in the account (with \-\-all), or everything in a container,will be deleted as well, unless you specify the \-\-leave\-segments option.is not provided the storage-url retrieved after authentication is used asswift \-A https://127.0.0.1:443/auth/v1.0 \-U swiftops:swiftops \-K swiftops stat
deleted_lines: The -p or --prefix is an option that will only list items beginning with that prefix. The -d or --delimiter is option (for container listings only)The -l and --lh options provide more detail, similar to ls -l and ls -lh, the latterremaining args. The -c or --changed is an option that will only upload files that have changed since the last upload. The --object-name <object-name> isand use <object-name> as object prefix. The -S <size> or --segment-size <size> and --leave-segments are options as well (see --help for more).also allow the -r (or --read-acl) and -w (or --write-acl) options. The -m or --meta option is allowed on all and used to define the user meta data\fBExample\fR: post -m Color:Blue -m Size:LargeDownloads everything in the account (with --all), or everything in aobject download, you may use the -o [--output] <filename> option to-H [--header].Deletes everything in the account (with --all), or everything in a container,will be deleted as well, unless you specify the --leave-segments option.is not provided the storage-url retreived after authentication is used asswift -A https://127.0.0.1:443/auth/v1.0 -U swiftops:swiftops -K swiftops stat

commit_message:
Add HEAD api response for test s3 server BucketHandler

Current nova test s3 server lacks HEAD for BucketHandler. And it becomes
an issue for Boto after version 2.25.0 [1], which changes underlying
implementation of get_bucket method from GET to HEAD request.

This change fixes this gap by adding HEAD response to test s3 server.
And also added cases for testing bucket existence per Boto document
suggestion[2], which applies for both Boto prior to or after version
2.25.0

[1] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/releasenotes/v2.25.0.html
[2] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/s3_tut.html#accessing-a-bucket

Closes-bug: #1277790
(cherry picked from commit 033f3776c4bc6d0db14b1b9da7c24e207e9628ab)

Add two end-of-file checks to bash8.  Firstly, alert if heredoc hasn't
finished.  Some heredocs were done like:

---
sudo bash -c "cat <<EOF > foo
...
EOF"
---

(A better way to do this is "cat <<EOF | sudo tee ..." as it retains
the usual heredoc layout in the code).

The trailing quote was throwing the matching in bash8 off and it kept
appending the next file as if it was still part of the heredoc.  To
avoid this, we check if we're still in a heredoc when we start a new
file; if so raise an error and reset the heredoc status fresh.  We
track the state of the previous file, line and lineno so we can give a
good error.

---
E012: heredoc did not end before EOF: 'cat <<EOF'
 - lib/trove: L221
---

This includes fixes for the existing problem heredocs.

A similar EOF check is to ensure the previous file ended with a
newline.

---
E004: file did not end with a newline: '$MY_XTRACE'
 - lib/neutron_plugins/embrane: L40
---

This requires only one fix

Change-Id: I5e547d87b3921fc7ce6588c28f074e5c9f489c1f
'}]
commit_message:
Add end-of-file checks to bash8

Add two end-of-file checks to bash8.  Firstly, alert if heredoc hasn't
finished.  Some heredocs were done like:

---
sudo bash -c "cat <<EOF > foo
...
EOF"
---

(A better way to do this is "cat <<EOF | sudo tee ..." as it retains
the usual heredoc layout in the code).

The trailing quote was throwing the matching in bash8 off and it kept
appending the next file as if it was still part of the heredoc.  To
avoid this, we check if we're still in a heredoc when we start a new
file; if so raise an error and reset the heredoc status fresh.  We
track the state of the previous file, line and lineno so we can give a
good error.

---
E012: heredoc did not end before EOF: 'cat <<EOF'
 - lib/trove: L221
---

This includes fixes for the existing problem heredocs.

A similar EOF check is to ensure the previous file ended with a
newline.

---
E004: file did not end with a newline: '$MY_XTRACE'
 - lib/neutron_plugins/embrane: L40
---

This requires only one fix

Change-Id: I5e547d87b3921fc7ce6588c28f074e5c9f489c1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/14/75314/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: return re.search("^%s\s*$" % token, line) is not None

subject: Add GIT_TIMEOUT variable to watch git operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 03:08:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/c5e355cc099253b0614f51141afc77a77def9e9d', 'message': 'Add GIT_TIMEOUT variable to watch git operations

commit_message:
Add GIT_TIMEOUT variable to watch git operations

During my CI testing of each devstack change I can often see git get
itself stuck and hang indefinitely.  I'm not sure if it's transient
network issues, or issues at the remote end (seen with both github.com
and git.openstack.org) but it hits fairly frequently.  Retrying the
command usually gets it going again.  Searching for "git hanging" and
similar shows its not entirely uncommon...

This adds a watchdog timeout for remote git operations based on a new
environment variable GIT_TIMEOUT.  It will retry 3 times before giving
up.  The wrapper is applied to the main remote git calls.

Change-Id: I5b0114ca26b7ac2f25993264f761cba9ec8c09e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/10/74910/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set a timeout for git operations. If git is still running when the # timeout expires, the command will be retried up to 3 times. This is # in the format for timeout(1); # # DURATION is a floating point number with an optional suffix: 's' # for seconds (the default), 'm' for minutes, 'h' for hours or 'd' # for days. # # Zero disables timeouts GIT_TIMEOUT=${GIT_TIMEOUT:-0}
